situation: i'm doing a bad job at my job and there are rumors i'll be fired soon. i am a newscaster at a small radio station. basically this job is too much for me.  i feel tremendous pressure.

dialog.text: How can I help you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i think i'm about to get fired from my job. i feel tremendous pressure. the uncertainty is kiling me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm so sorry to hear that you are about to lose your job.  That sounds very stressful.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i'm not certain. i hear rumors.  it would have been nice if my boss spoke to me directly instead of blabbing about this behind my back.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That sounds very difficult that things are not openly discussed. It sounds like you want to be proactive which is good though.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: it's awful.  this job is too hard for me.  getting fired would put me in a big financial hole.  my head is spinning.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you thought at all about looking for a new job that might not be so stressful?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i am about to start doing that but it's tricky. i'm a radio announcer and if your boss finds our you're looking for another job he can use that as a reason to fire you.  there are ways to get around this but it's complicated. small time radio is a difficult mess.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there anyone you can contact who has been in a similar situation to help you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i wish there was someone like that.  i've talked to people in the past about this type of situation but i wasn't the one under the gun.  but your advice is good and i'll try and think of someone who might be able to help me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's great that you are so willing to try different options to move forward.  Perhaps a family member may help?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i haven't told the specifics of this mess to my parents; i dont want to burden them with this.  they worry about me enough as it is.  my sisters wouldn't be able to help me.  they both have seirous emotional issues and are both in very bad marriages and have plenty of their own problems.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Just from chatting with you, I can see why you are anxious.  Have you tried any deep breathing techniques.  They are often helpful when dealing with stress.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: that's a good idea.  i think i'll try that. and praying.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Praying is also an excellent idea.  My friends and I prayed all day long for each other during a difficult exam that I previously had failed and had to retake.  That day everyone passed the exam.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: praying is a wonderful thing that i need to do more often.  i'm glad you passed the exam.  i had a lot of pressure when i went to college as well. it seems most of my 24 years alive i've had one sort of probem or another but i always remember that i have plenty of things to be thankful for too. life can be rough.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My grandmother always encouraged me by saying there is always someone who has it rougher.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Things can be really hard but you can do it.  You are working hard and trying so hard.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Then I just started going downhill from there.....have had difficulty finding another job, or trying to replace lost income.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: which has been frustrating in and of itself. I know it's all mental, but I just can't break through.

dialog.text: You have to remain positive and keep your head and tell your self everything will be okay

dialog.text: I can understand how you are feeling and you are not alone

dialog.text: it's tremendously helpful

dialog.text: You are welcome. Everything will be okay just know that.

dialog.text: You're right...I do know that, I just need to truly believe it. Every day is a new day for opportunity and to be better then yesterday.

situation: worried about losing my job

dialog.text: I understand. Is there a coworker or mentor that maybe you can talk to?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I will reach out to HR.

dialog.text: That's a great idea!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you. You have been very helpful and uplifting.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Also review your employee handbook and see if there are things you can do to negotiate with HR or your boss in regards to your hours.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Always best to come prepared :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My anxiety is disappearing with the suggestions you have offered.

dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have only been here for 6 months. I think being new is contributing to the anxiety I am feeling.

dialog.text: I understand. Being new at a job can have its difficulties.

dialog.text: From speaking with you, it seems like you are caring and hardworking.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for your encouragement.

dialog.text: I hope your boss can understand you are facing a difficult time. If he has loved ones or family of his own, he surely will.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Is there anything else I can help you with today?

situation: I broke up with my partner last month and I'm in a funk

dialog.text: Hello. How are you tonight?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm hanging in there. I'm in a funk.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear things aren't going to well. What's the problem in a nutshell?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I split with my girlfriend after 5 years together last month/
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Breakups can be hard, I can understand your frustration. Five years is a long time to have a relationship and then end.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I caught her cheating on me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that. That's hard to forgive and move on from that.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm trying to just move on but I feel so insulted. I'm mad then sad back and forth, over and over.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I find that when I have a very painful situation, I try to only thing about it for a certain amount of time. Then I make a list of things to do so I can be occupied to not think about it.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, but my whole life was upended. My living situation, my friend circle is broken up over this. I don't know how to move on. Any suggestions?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Getting over a breakup will take time? Have you ever heard of DABDA? Denial (I can't believe this happened!) Anger (we all know that) Bargaining (If only I had done that, or if only - trying to make it FEEL better by imagining other scenarios - doesn't really work) Depression - sadness, then Acceptance -- we go in and out of these emotions and sometimes it can make us feel crazy, but all of them are normal in varying degrees and we don't know when they will happen.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, but those sound like the typical stages of grief. I guess I'm in anger. I have no interest in barbagining.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would make a list of things you have always wanted to do and then just BRAINSTORM any idea, no idea is too out there -- learn to ice skate, learn to play the ukulele, sign up for dance lessons, join the gym, go to a singles group at church, visit the elderly, volunteer somewhere.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think I need to focus on exercise. Just get my body and mind healthy and full of energy. What do you think?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I also find it helpful not only to limit how much I dwell on my pain, but make sure I reach out to help someone else. I will tell you, that is the secret to happiness. Maybe help a neighbor with groceries or hanging lights. Old people (me) love help, bake something or call your aunt or uncle.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: True, but it's hard not to dwell. It's not like I have a choice. It overcomes me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I agree, get healthy and try to help others. One thing about feelings is that if you change your mind, you can change your feelings, it might happen slowly, but if you put your mind off of it, it will help. Not saying NEVER feel the emotions, but feelings are the tail of the dog, not the dog itself, You do not have to be ruled by them. You don not have to FEEL like going for a walk to go for a walk.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's hard not to just drown myself in booze and cannabis.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: A healthy balance of self care, and other centered behavior and know this will take time. I just takes time.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Time heals all wounds for sure
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand, but those are choices that really, long term, are not for your benefit. Her cheating was a reflection on HER bad character, not yours. You have to love yourself and try to fight this.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Are you Ai or a human mturker?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm a human. I live in KY, retired counselor! hhahaha I prayed for someone to encourage.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: OH cool. Well your prayer came true. I'm, also a human....from Georgia
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm from the city, so there isn't much to do on a farm in the middle of cold weather. I have been through a lot of breakups, so I know what works, and yes, I was cheated on, devastating. But you can overcome this. Make that list and do NOT let your feelings rule your life. You can recover and find someone worthy of your love and care.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks so much!!! I really appreciate it! :)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: The WORST breakup came a year before I met my husband. in retrospect, it was the best thing, listen,you could have married this girl, count your blessings. cheating is just terribly destructive. And you are welcome. Take care of yourself. Write the list of goals and fun things to do, choose one every day.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You are very kind! All the best!! Take care!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Bye now! God bless!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I am worried about a friend. Since lockdown they have not been in contact and whenever I try to get in touch with them they rarely respond.

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there, how can I help you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My friend has been quiet and non responsive for some time and I'm starting to worry about them. This is a pretty recent thing, ever since lockdown.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is this a close friend of yours that you would normally speak to every day or see on a regular basis?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes that's correct, however with lockdown I haven't seen any friends for a long time face to face.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ok so you have are close friend, who you used to engage with regularly and now you are worried because when you try and contact them, they aren't responding.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes that's the issue. I think lockdown is affecting people in many ways and I want to make sure they are OK
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can tell that you feel a lot for your friend and it shows that you care about lot about them.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes I do. Now what should I do about them as other friends in our peer group are also concerned?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ok, I understand. Have you tried reaching out to their family members as they may have a loser handle on how this person is feeling at the moment?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I actually haven't. I'm not that close to their family to be honest so I'm not quite sure how to do that?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You could try reaching out to friends on Facebook or social media, you can find contact details for them that way and perhaps send them a direct message. You are a concerned friend which means they probably wouldn't mind if you did get in touch.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I didn't think about contacting family that way. That's a good suggestion.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I had a friend once that was acting out of character. They weren't quiet but I could tell them here was something different in the way they were acting etc. It turns out that they had started a new relationship with another friend of mine and didn't want anyone else to know. In reality everything was fine. There was an explainable reason behind the behaviour and it was nothing bad in the end.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Perhaps I am worried about nothing and your experience does make sense. I may be reading too much into these things but you read about people's mental health being affected by COVID isolation these days.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is true. Mental health issues have increased  significantly since lockdowns began
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: As they are not responding to your attempts to get in touch, you could think has anything else changed for them other than lockdown, for example are they busier at work? have childcare commitments? Life is complicated, they may not have the time for legitimate reasons.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is true. I think they are probably very busy at the moment but as they are typically so outgoing it did strike me as odd. What else would you suggest?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You mentioned that other friends were also concerned about them, have you tried talking to them about setting up a video call with a group. This might appeal to your friend and they may see this as a fun activity to get involved in.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think I'll give that a try. Maybe they don't have time but a fun relaxing group chat might be the way forward. Thanks for this suggestion. I'll give this a go.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No problem happy to help.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a defeatist way to talk! Just because a couple of relationships fail does not mean that you will never be able to find happiness.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well, if past experience has any powers of prediction. I get super clingy, and do this push and pull thingy, where I break up and call them names, and then become so embarrassed it's hard to even bring it up. my last boyfriend said he thought i had borderline disorder
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have been in that position too. I hate it when I realise that I am not being rational but I can't seem to stop myself sometimes and this has sometimes let to problems with my inter personal relationships
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yea, that definitely seems to be part of my problem. I really thought he was different, too. And when he broke up with me, I tried to get him to spend the night with me in a hotel, and I felt so pathetic because I was practically begging for sex
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think I am an addict.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hear you on that one too! It's horrible to feel that you are losing your self respect but I suspect that we've all done it at some point. Have you considered getting some counselling?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sigh.. yes. I have seen several. I also take meds from a psychiatrist.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hear  you saying that they are not really effective, is that true?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well... one told me that I should be put down like a dog to my face.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: so, yea
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Okay .. I hope you reported him!!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I didn't. I was younger then. who knows. not gonna lie. maybe they're right. Sometimes I think I'm a psycho. My last therapist was always doing deep breathing exercises. It didn't help.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I also have a lot of anxiety. A LOT!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I even got an emotiona support dog
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand that as well .. I am on medication for it. A dog is a wonderful thing to have! Do you feel that it has helped you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yea, he's my best friend. At least I have one boy who has to stick around. He's on a tight leash
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Dogs are very very loyal. They never cheat on you or walk out on you!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: So trueee :) I just wish I wasn't such a freak.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think you are probably not anywhere near as bad as you think you are you know :). Anyway I wish you all the very best for the New Year and hope that things pick up for you soon!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Alright, bud. Thanks. You, too
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: take care!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: (you need to quit first and take the survey .. I can't :))

situation: My youngest sister is battling with heroin addiction, and I am raising her two children.

dialog.text: Hello, thanks for offering to help.  My sister is battling with heroin addiction, and I am raising her children.  It's quite a bit of pressure and responsibility.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi! Of course. I am happy to help.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh wow, that is really stressful. You are such a godo person for taking on her children. You should feel really good about yourself.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: She has been in and out of rehab, and I see no end to her problems, other than a tragic one.  Thankfully, the children are adjusting to it, probably because they are happy just to be in a stable environment.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are you raising them alone?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have a romantic partner who helps.  I also have two of my own relatively young children.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So, four in total.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's a lot of children! It's great that you have a partner who can help you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: A dear friend of mine is in rehab and had to give up her children, it is really awful to watch. It makes me feel so helpless, so i understand how you msut be feeling.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks for being sympathetic and for the words of encouragement.  Yes, needless to say, Child Protective Services were involved, and I was granted Foster Parent status.  I'm sure your friend went down that road, sadly.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you ever seen the video by the artist known as NF called "How Could You Leave Us?"  I'm afraid that's what's next for these kids.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, she did. Her children seem very lucky to have you. Do they get along with your children?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I haven't seen that, waht happens in it?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: They all get along famously.   You can find that video on YouTube.  It's a true story of how his mother died from heroin addiction.  It's a powerful song.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hopefully, you never have to experience it.  Heroin (opioids) just grabs hold of people and doesn't let go.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's so awful. the only thing you can do is show the kids love and make them feel cared for.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Addiction is a truly awful disease, people don't appreciate the toll it takes on families.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you.  One piece of good news.  Her son went from failing most of his classes to making Honor Roll this trimester - that's what his advisor tells me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You've been really helpful and considerate.  Chatting with you certainly made me feel better.  I think we can end the support session at this juncture if you've met your session requirements.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's so good!!!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I hope i was helpful!! have a great day and continue being such a good support for the kids. I am very impressed.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks so, much.  Have a great holiday and we'll try to do the same.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You too. Enjoy the holidays!!!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hopefully, you all get to spend so much time togehter.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you consulted with a job center, a life coach, or any other resource such as online websites? These may be useful.

dialog.speaker: usr

situation: COVID, job pressure, stress with partner, sharing custody of my son, recuperating from cancer treatment

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hello, how are you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Im am fine, How's things today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Stressful, but I have to deal with it. I can't afford to not be present.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand that many people now in these days are in a position where he or she needs to be at a location and that is stressfull
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: So i guess the point of this is for me to talk about what it is that I'm facing?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have to have a brave face for everyone because I'm in charge of young people. I have to be strong for them, but it leaves me feeling exhausted
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being a father of two girls makes my skin cringe. Young people can be very challenging. Tell me more about this?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I teach special needs students, and they definitely make me happy. It's a very, very rewarding job. However, with political division and COVID, it's hard to reach this population. Parents are not supportive. I feel like I'm being stretched so thin.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm also a parent, and my son is doing virtual learning, so he's just as isolated.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I remember a time where learning crisis management that taking a deep breath and meditating in the positive work that you are doing can open up your mind to suggestions from your inner self. Have you ever thought that you superb skills can transmit in your home as well?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Getting to that mindsight is challenging when the overwhelming feelings of 'failure' loom so heavily. I was seeing a therapist and making great strides, then he informed me that he was moving to a private practice. I cannot afford his sliding scale, and I feel let down. It's just that when one thing starts to go wrong, other things follow. Most of the time I see myself as a positive person that can work through challenging situations, but like you said it's a tough time for everyone
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So now that you understand that you have a awesome skill and that is being positive, build on this. What building blocks can you write down that has helped you pushed through the fire and keep it some where close to you to always give you piece of mind and reinforce your habits of pushing through the fire.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well, I am not one for journaling or anything. I try to stay active. I am about 6 months into remission from stage 4 HL (cancer) and it's been quite the emotional journey there. With that said, the mental and physical overhaul left quite a dent in my overall feelings about myself. I'm just now able to run again and in the past week I ran 2 5k's. To me, this was monumental and made me feel great. I'm also learning how to not overextend myself. I just keep hoping for continued improvement in all areas. The reinforcement is just that I can get through this, these feelings are only temporary.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I totally understand that you are not for writing things down to keep. Yet, you have gone through a alot of events in your life where other would have given up. The key is transmitting your successes regardless of the situations. COVID is not going anywhere and as a person who has beaten stage 4 cancer, it is scary to be living in these times. You are doing monumental things, never forget that because your feelings and stamina for living will bind everything together. Politics, is the dirtiest and no government can solve  and will solve the problems in the world.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thank you for listening. It helps to sometimes just get it out there. I have to go coach now (virtually). Have a great evening.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You too as well
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: anytime
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I lost my job 4 month ago and I am running out of money.

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello, how are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I was looking for some assistance. I lost my job 4 month ago
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Losing your job is one of the biggest stressors in life, how have you been handling it?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well first few month was kind off alright, Was looking for a job in different places without success. And now I am really depressed and I feel so useless.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I know what it's like to lose a job, and when it's hard to find a new one it can really make you feel low. What activities have you been doing in addition to seeking new employment?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Nice that you understand me, I was trying job websites alongside with jobcenter in town centre. I have jobseeker allowance but it will not cover the rent
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am living in a high-rent city and the only way I was able to keep my apartment was to find a roommate. Are there ways you can get help from friends or family until a new job opens up?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am renting just a room at the moment, Before I had a girlfriend so we had to split the bill. After she left I had to take all responsibility just on myself to pay bills. I have few friends but don't think they could lend me a lot of money anyway
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: One possible solution, if it's possible for you, could be to sub-lease your room to someone else and stay with friends or family. Even if they can't loan you money, they may be able to let you stay with them for a week while you make money renting your room as an airbnb.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh AirBnB might be a solution actually. I will speak to my cousin if I could stay couple of nights at his place.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What sort of employment are you looking for? Perhaps we can brainstorm some places you can go to make connections for potential work.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I was working in IKEA warehouse before I got redundant
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Working in a warehouse shows you have great skills for several other types of jobs. Have you checked small independent-contractor sites like TaskRabbit or Lyft to make extra funds while you search for a new permanent job?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I even haven't heard about those. I am really useless sometimes... What kind of jobs I can find there do you know?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, if you didn't know about them, that's not your fault. It's possible that you could find a new job opportunity while working on smaller tasks or by volunteering for a local organization. You could meet new folks who could provide you with new connections for employment!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I Will definitely try that. You are really helpful. Have you been doing any jobs through those websites?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes I am able to make a little spending money by doing small tasks like delivering real estate papers, or delivery take-out food. You can google a list of sites like RentSons.com where you can sign up to do an assortment of tasks, and your warehouse skills will come in handy!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's cool, I feel now a lot better. Maybe I will be able to find even a girlfriend somewhere on those jobs. I feel lonely after my girlfriend left me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: We all feel lonely when life gets hard, but getting yourself out there to do tasks will help you feel useful AND you could meet your future wife, you never know! I wish you the absolute best!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you very much for you help. I learned something new today and feel much better
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You're welcome. I think you'll do great.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have a lovely afternoon!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You too!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Ok well that should be something that you can take pride in.  Do you have contact with your friends and family?  I have found that for me calling my mom or chatting with my friends that truly know me makes me feel more connected to others.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I talk to my mom often, but i was isolated from most of my friends for years so im trying to meet new ones.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's great that you speak to your mom.  I know it can be hard to open yourself up and meet new friends but I think you can do it.  Are there maybe some people at your job that you would consider making friends with?  I think that would be a great place to start because you would already have something in common.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do have friends from my job, but i currently commute 1.5 hours for work which makes it hard. I feel that with time i may be more open to more friends, but right now i just want those that already know my back story for comfort.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: OK I see.  So for now you would like to be able to get comfort from the people that already know you and your story.  One suggestion that I have would be to really try to reach out and contact those people.  I know that with work and life in general it is easy to lose touch.  Not that you stop caring for a person but things just get hetic from time to time.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: MY Son-in-Law is treating our daughter and Grandaughter indifferent, gaslighting and treats the dog better.

dialog.text: Hi and good afternoon
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you for your time
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello, and good afternoon yourself. How are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Doing pretty good. Struggling a little
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What is making you struggle?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My situation involves our Daughter and Son-in-Law. He is not treating her well, rude, gaslighting and treating the dog better. He is also not very nice to our grandaughter
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: This is confidential, Right?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, of course it is :). So we are talking about your daughter and her husband and their child together, right?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, He is a nice guy to others. At home he is so different.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand, people can often show different sides depending on who is around. Do you have any reason to think your daughter or granddaughter are in physical danger?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, they are safe. He's, like I said, a nice guy. Our Daughter, we are very close and she would tell us.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's great news! It sounds as though you are just concerned about how she is sometimes being treat. Have you had any conversation with your daughter about their relationship?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, numerous. Like I said we are close to our daughter. She wants to stay together and talks with him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: He stays for whatever reason. I wish he would talk to me, to us. We have offered.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: He knows that we care about him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And that is so important and good to know there is trust from his side, to me it sounds as though that could be an olive branch for you to try and establish a conversation with both of them. An open and positive communication is always the first step in resolving anything.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We have tried this before when we visit and he appears receptive. Treats he well and then when we are gone. He falls back into he behaviour.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I recently went though a similar exercise with a friend and her boyfriend. We sat down in a room and spoke about our feelings. We had ground rules first and everyone knew they could talk without being judged or escalating.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Maybe you could suggest follow up conversations, re-cap about what was spoken about previously and they can both evaluate how they have progressed since then?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thats sounds like a good idea. We have talked with them individually. Now the next step. We shall see.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah consistency leads to accountability. I like the idea. Thank you.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I believe you have both their interests in mind. You sound like a positive person and you are just concerned for all 3 people involved.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: For sure, she is our daughter and our granddaughter needs her daddy.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hope they will be well receptive of your suggestion for a follow up.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you. I have some good ideas after chatting with you.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No worries, I'm grateful for your time as well. If there is nothing else, I hope it all goes well and you have a wonderful weekend :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You, too. I appreciate your time, listening ear and advice. Take care and God Bless.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I have found out that my friends have been socialising behind my back without me. This makes me very sad.

dialog.text: Hi there, are you free to talk? I am feeling rather sad.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there. Yes, What is making you sad?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I feel that my friends do not like me very much any more. Apparently they have been engaging in group activities without me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand how frustrating that can be to not be part of the group activities.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you think that I am over-reacting? I do not want to sound over sensitive but this has been happening for a while.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you talked with your friends on how you feel? When was the last time you all connected?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We went out for coffee the other day and I thought about saying something cos I know they went to a club without me last weekend but I couldn't bring myself to in the end.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand it is tough to bring up what is bothering you, especially after getting to hang out with all your friend over coffee. I'm sure this was not intentional with not inviting you to the club.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sometimes in the past I have turned down invitations to go out clubbing, admittedly. Could it be that they just did not think that I wanted to go?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: From what I have experienced personally, I am not a fan of clubs and didnt want to go with my friends. After turning them down a few times, they stopped inviting as well. I think they thought that was not my thing.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: The thing is though that this is not the only thing - they have been to rock concerts without me too. I just feel I am no longer a part of the group.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I feel how this is hurting you. The best thing would be to talk to them about feeling disinvited to group activities. Let them know you are still free and really want to spend some time together. Do you think you can open up to them on whats bothering you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't know. I don't want to come across as just being paranoid or whiny. Sometimes I think it would be better to just forget them and not have any friends.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It sounds like this situation is really bothering you. Its hard and overwhelming to feel isolated. The bonds of friendship are worth the confrontation. If they don't know what is bothering you, it will be harder to mend the relationship.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It is making me really depressed and is badly damaging my sense of self worth. I feel as though I am not worth anyone's time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are worth every precious second of time and should not let this diminish your self worth. Find common ground, an activity you all enjoy and invite them to hang with you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you that is helpful. What if I reach out and they all snub me though?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: We all have busy hectic lives at time. True friends make time to be with one another. This world is full of beautiful people to bond with. Keeping a closed circle of friends is a blessing.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's not really so much that my life is hectic. On the contrary, sometimes it feels as though it is rather empty and not having the support of friends does not help with that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Anyway I do appreciate your help - you have given me things to think about.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hear how this is making you sad not feeling supported in the way that you need to be. Know that you are worthy and will find a way to connect with them. I hope this has helped.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It has .. thank you very much and enjoy your day!
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: Really dislike my job in this current environment and would like to try online sales

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It is a tricky situation, to be sure. Have you talked to anyone else about it?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yes my wife, and she is supportive either way so that's not a problem
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am glad to hear that you have someone supportive in your life. What is your current line of work?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: e-commerce manager for walmart stores inc
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Would you like a total change? Or just a change of scenery?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: looking to work exclusively at home in sales which is more my specialization, so yes to both questions
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Online work can be very lucrative. I have been doing it for years personally. It is nice to be your own boss and choose your own hours.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I currently do day trading on the side and make great money at it but want something stable to challenge me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It is true that stability is important. Do I hear you say that you are frightened of the insecurity of working from home?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: more so the lack of benefits I would lose, especially healthcare
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ah .. I am in the UK so we have socialised medicine :). Would you feel more comfortable if you lived in a country like that?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: lol definitely! Currently I pay $750 monthly if I purchase healthcare on my own but only $163 monthly through my work
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Goodness .. I do not have to pay anything. Also our prescriptions are fixed at about ten pounds each.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think maybe your job dilemma would be easier if you moved to a different country :D
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I would lose about $3000 monthly leaving my job
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You might be able to make that much from home though. And what's life if you don't take the odd risk?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: still there?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes I am :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Is there anything else that you'd like to talk about ?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I hope I have been able to be of some help to you :)
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I don't know what to do anymore, everything in my life is going downward.

dialog.text: Hi there how are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm good thank you, how about you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am okay thanks. Is there anything you'd like to talk to me about right now?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I don't know what to do anymore, I'm just lazy on everything. I don't have any motivation anymore
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It sounds to me like you are suffering from depression. That sounds scary but it really is common. Would you consider professional help?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't know, I don't even talk to my family anymore, I'm just at my room watching and playing all the time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That definitely does sound like depression to me. I have been there myself and I promise you that there is help available.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do still talk to my friends though through voice call, that's the only thing I've been doing lately play games with them
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I guess that the pandemic has not helped at all with things?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah the pandemic too affected me but this was going on before the pandemic
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Can't have improved the situation though. Do you know that there are many free counselling services out there that you could utilise?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know but I don't have the courage to do so, I'm kind of shy, really shy.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hear you - I found it very difficult to go to counselling too but when I did I found it very helpful.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know I should seek help, but I don't have the guts, what should I do to have the will to do it?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I do not have any easy suggestions. It took me a good deal of time to be brave enough too. But you can ask yourself - can't things only get better?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Or even if they don't, you don't really have anything to lose :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know, I should set aside my pride and seek help, I hope I muster the courage to do it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hope you can too :). I wish you all the best in the future
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: (can you press quit first - I can't do it from my end :))
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Okay, thank you for your time, I really appreciate it ;)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You too and best wishes!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have a good day
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: likewise
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: you just need to press quit and take the survey :)
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I found my mom murdered on the side of her house

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have a real pickle of a problem
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that, can you tell me what it is?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am depressed and all alone
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's a hard situation to be in.  Are you isolating due to the pandemic?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have been isolated for 2 years now ever since my wife decided to sneak out in the middle of the night and run away
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's really rough.  It sounds like you did not get to have any closure whatsoever.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah what a peach she was, at least she didnt murder me like my brother did to my mom
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: There's a lot of dark stuff happening in and around your life.  Do you have any things that you like to do on your own that calm you down?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: drinking is the only thing that takes the pain away
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have definitely been there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: everytime I say it cant get any worse I get a new illness
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It must seem like things are just piling on.  Booze does this crazy thing where we think it's making things easier, but it's really making things 10x harder.  10x harder to process emotions, 10x harder to find the motivation, 10x harder to believe you are worth the effort to keep moving.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: all I have to look forward to is fighting for pennies on mturk all day, who would ever countinue if thats all they had
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think you could give the booze a break for a week, and see if you may see things in a different light.  Zero judgment from me btw, I am also clearly on mturk, and I quit drinking in April after ten years of heavy heavy drinking.  Almost lost my marriage to it.  It's not easy, and I'm not preaching, but I am saying it was the best thing I could do to begin to improve my life and my health, mental and physical.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: wait till everything is taken away from you and your left with nothing and noone and see how you feel then, it might be time for a drink
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm really sorry you're feeling this poorly.  If you could be doing anything at all right now, what would it be?

dialog.text: Why can't you ride motorcycles any more?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: poverty
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ah, so you can still physically ride one!  Your life isn't over, you are still breathing, you will ride a motorcycle again.

dialog.text: i was riding a motorcyle next to my brother about two years before he murdered our mom, got hit by a car and nearly died

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Maybe you could rent one

dialog.text: or I could just steal one

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: well my car is about to die so it will be walking soon
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Perhaps you'll meet someone on the bus?

dialog.text: going over how horrible everything is for me all day has been a real treat

dialog.text: that one really made me laugh

situation: I worried if I will be able to complete my degree.

dialog.text: Hello!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hello, how are you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am doing great, how about you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am doing good. Can I talk to you about something?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course you can, tell me about it :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am worried that I won't be able to complete my degree.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Why so?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I can't get motivated, it doesn't seem worth it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hey I've been there too, but it really helped me meditating and going out with nature to clear my mind of things. You should try it!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What do you meditate about?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Nothing special, just sit in my room in silence. Listen to tutorials on youtube to meditate
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: They get me relaxed and motivated for the day :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I feel like I would sit there and worry about things I have not done yet.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's part of meditation! I too worry while meditating, but when i'm listening to the videos and following instructions all those worries go away :) If that doesn't help you, you can go out in nature to clear your mind off things. Being in the wild really motivates me to continue.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Maybe it will calm me down. Does it make it easier to concentrate?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Meditating absolutely does since the whole point is to clear your mind off things and concentrate on the task ahead.And the wild? that's whole other experience because you either concentrate on things or you get mesmerized by nature :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That sounds amazing, I should give it a try :)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Please do! You can try it with friends or alone. With friends can be a more fun experience while alone can be more spiritual or calming
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hello...

dialog.text: How are you doing today?

situation: My son is a recovering meth addict and has relapsed again. After two weeks of using he admitted himself back into rehab as he as done many times in the past without a lot of success. I am afraid it will be the same this time, that he will get out of rehab and then start using again.

dialog.text: HI, how are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am not doing well. I am very worried about my son's chances of recovery after so many relapses and frustrated because I know there is really nothing I can do to change things for him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You must be very frustrated from feeling unable to do something.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am. He is a different person when he's not on drugs but when he is using he can get really mean and he scares me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I remember when my mother was having end of life mental declining issues. I understand feeling as if the person is changing and having unusual moods and mood swings.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you have anyone you can talk to?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I try not to think about the situation, because I don't see him since he lives in another state. But I can't get everything out of my mind. And yes I have my husband to talk to, that helps some. It's when I'm trying to sleep or when my husband isn't home that's the worst for me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are feeling the way anybody in your situation would fee like. It must be helpful to have a husband who listens and can be supportive when he is there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you always had sleep issues?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It does help but he's as frustrated and upset as I am. I can't sleep at night for dwelling on everything and I don't know how to stop the thoughts about all the terrible things that could happen.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: When I'm upset about something I cannot sleep but if I'm in a good state of mind I sleep well.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being upset can make someones mind race and make it really difficult to rest or get any sleep at all.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you ever gone through anything like this before?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes I've been dealing with my son's addiction and recovery and relapses for the last three years.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can relate to being close to someone who is addicted. It can feel very sad and lonely at times. I would want to change the person in my life but just has to learn to let go instead. It is a process that takes years to learn.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am realizing that more every day. If it wasn't my son and just a good friend I would probably end the relationship but a mother can't do that to her own children, you know what I mean?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And you are so right. I can't change or control him, I can only change and control myself and my responses to him. That is so difficult to do.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, I understand how it can feel like our children are always our babies and we want to fix everything for them. Sometimes it feels like we can change them or re raise them if we just do more for them.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you had the chance to speak to a close friend or pastor about this situation?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not really. Most of my friends haven't dealt with that so they don't really understand what I am going through, or even what my son is going through. But you're right, I have to learn to let go and let him fix his own problems with no intereference from me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are very self aware and have good insight. I notice that you are very in touch with your feelings. You can use writing as a way to release emotions and express yourself, as you are now.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you, I will try that. Like a journal maybe?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, I can recommend a journal on Amazon that I also use. Thank you for sharing with me today.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Please reach back out anytime.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you so much! I appreciate what you do!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I am sad about not having family near me. I am in a town all alone.

dialog.text: Hi! How are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi, I am in a town all alone and far from family. I have been really depressed.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Why are you in a town all alone?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I moved away and I thought I would be happier on my own but now all I do is think about them and miss them. Nobody ever has time to talk on the phone so I am all alone.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you have the option to move back? Because family is the most important thing at the end of the day
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, I was living with my mom and dad but when I moved out my brother got my room. He and I didnt get along so he would never want me to move back into the house with them either.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: At this point, you will have to ask your family to make time to talk with you and im sure they will understand if they hear where you are coming from
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is a good idea, I can reach out to my mom. Maybe I should write her an email or something?My brother was a bully and so he is a big reason that I moved. My parents encouraged us to fight and argue, it wasn't a very fun place to live.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I've always been closer to my mom so she is much more understanding. She helps me pay my monthly bills too.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah reach out to your mum, and although you fight and argue, they are still your family at the end of the day
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thats nice of her :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, that is a good point. I have always heard the blood is thicker than water.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have also been upset lately because I had to leave all my pets when I moved out. I left my dog and my cat back at home.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you visited them ever since?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, I am too far away to stop by or go for the weekend. I would have to plan a whole trip and I cant really afford it yet. My brother knew that the pets were mine but he demanded that he keep them there and I didnt want to fight with him so I said fine.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: If they are your pets you should be able to keep them but you did the right thing as to not argue with your brother and your parents could  help you look after them
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, you are right. Once he let the gate open just so my dog would run away, he says he didn't do it but I know him and he is really mean and vengeful. He would also pull pranks on me that were just cruel. He once told me that my cat was ran over but he was just hiding her at a friends house for a week.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah, he doesn't seem very nice, but its good that you don't retaliate negatively
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, I used to be really depressed living there. I haven't thought about why I moved but you are helping me remember that i'm better off now. I am lonely but so much happier not living in the turmoil over there.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Its a good thing you moved then because at least now you are away from him
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You should always try to be happy
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yep, I am feeling better today . Thank you for listening. Maybe I should just get a new rescue dog or something like that today? I don't want to dwell on my brother or that negativity. I am feeling a lot more hopeful just sharing my feelings.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes its good to not dwell on the past like that. Have a good day :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks! Have a great day too!
dialog.speaker: usr

It does drive me crazy sometimes because i want some alone time but all i can really do at this point is just go outside and take a walk or just sit outside and that helps me most the time.

situation: My turning another year older and still have nothing to show for my life, no friends or career. I'm undiagnosed autistic with mental health issues and I'm very alone and unsupported

dialog.text: Hello there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there something you want to discuss?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yes
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My birthday's coming up and I feel a lot of self-hatred for what I've failed to accomplish by this age.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So it sounds like the birthday is a time for self-reflection, and you're not happy with where you are right now?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yea that's right. It's weighing heavy on my mind at the moment
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is this something you've felt on previous birthdays?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yes, the older I get the worse the feeling is. I didn't used to hate birthdays when I was younger
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'll confess I have felt the same way, especially with "milestone" birthdays (30, 40, 50, etc.).
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you think you are possibly expect too much in terms of achievements?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, those are hard. My 30th was difficult. Society has so many wrong ideas of where people need to be, and it just doesn't apply to me. I'm so different from normal people.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: maybe, but being autistic, even average achievements are hard for me. I have to work so hard just to be average
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: May I ask, how did you deal with your own birthday depression? Maybe I can learn from you
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: As I became older, i started to wonder what terms like  "normal people" and being "average" really mean.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Am I comparing myself to something that even exists?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's what I've been thinking about too. It probably doesn't exist, but society would have us believe otherwise
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's so true. It's tough to deal with.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But I will same, as I became older, I just stopped caring as much about what other's think. It just happened.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yep, it sure is. I figure people stop caring that much when they get older
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Also, I'm sure there are some things in life you are good at, even if those aren't what society seems to value.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've already stopped caring what people younger than me think. They just seem so young to me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: yea, it's just hard when I struggle so much with employment. My issues really keep me from succeeding in jobs
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sure, there are things I can do; but they don't seem to help me with anything important in life, if you know what I mean
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah, I hear you. Are you talking to others -  such as professionals, etc. - about your autism?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I was forced into therapy as a young person. I think it put me off seeking professional help because I hated the experience.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: But I talk to other autistic people in support groups online
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Also, I'm sorry to cut this off but I need to go soon. I want to tell you you're quite compassionate and kind
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being "forced" to do anything is usually a turn off. But it's good to hear there are groups online to help.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've enjoyed talking to you
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes indeed
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It's not a great experience unless you choose it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh, thanks. It's always nice to have a real conversation with someone.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: For sure. May I ask if you're planning to become a counselor?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I didn't know if this simulation is for people to get training for that type of wokr
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I haven't planned on it, but I am looking for a career change. But no, this wasn't training for me.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not sure what this simulation is all about :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh cool. I think this is a pretty interesting platform
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: haha me too, but it seemed interesting
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yep. Oh well, hope this was worth while for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I came here the other day and never got matched with anyone so I left.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thanks, it was. And you seem really cool
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I guess we can wrap up since it's over 15 mins
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: and they said we can stop after 15 i think
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thanks. Be sure to do something enjoyable on your birthday.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you:) Hope you enjoy your day/night
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: OK. Do I just hit "Quit"? I forget.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think we both have the finish button. So we can click any time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'll exit now. See you:)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Take care.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I feel I am getting looked over for a promotion/raise at work and it is causing anxiety and fear that I don’t have longevity at my company and that I’m not being valued.

dialog.text: Hi there, how are you  today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I???doing ok. Have been feeling a bit anxious about my job lately.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is this because of the pandemic? I know a lot of people are worrying about their jobs because of this.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think it???partially due to the pandemic. I am struggling progressing at my company and have been up for a raise for a year now that still hasn???gone through. It???making me feel like they don???value me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear that. So, I hear you saying that you feel you are not being valued for your work?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah exactly. I want to feel like I am an important member of the team and right now I???not feeling that and it makes me feel like I don???have a future with this career anymore. But now is not the time for a career change.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No I guess that it isn't. Have you tried talking to your employer about this? Or even your co workers?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think that???the part that gets me anxious. I don???really know how to communicate this to my superiors. There isn???a lot of open communication now that we all work from home.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there someone intermediate that you can talk to ? Or perhaps could you contact a union? There is help out there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Maybe going to HR would be the smart move? They might have some resources on how to navigate relationships now that we aren???in the office, right?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, I think that they would. Ultimately they are trained to help people who are in your situation.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have started applying to other jobs, but I don???have a lot of hope with that right now. Maybe it is better to looks at more options at my current job. Getting up the courage to speak out can be hard though!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Would you at least get a good reference from your previous employer?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think so! I have a cordial relationship with everyone, but I know my work speaks for itself. I think I need more confidence to ask for what I know I deserve.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Perhaps you could consider some sort of counselling to help you with you self esteem? I did it and it was great.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That???a really good idea. I think much of the anxiety I have with work stems from self esteem issues.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: There are people out there who can help. Would you consider anti anxiety medication?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think I???much more open to trying counseling before I would venture to trying medication options. Practicing talking to people at work might really help me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes I think that it would. Just start slowly - do not dive straight in at the deep end. But you seem to have a good and sensible perspective about this.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am trying to remain level-headed about this. I know this is within my control and I just need to muster up the courage to do something about this situation that has me feeling anxious and stressed!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I wish you all of the best with it! Thank you for talking to me.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks. Appreciate the perspective.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Goodnight :)
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I am recently divorced. My ex-husband has moved in with his new, much younger girlfriend and they are discussing marriage. Although I am happy the marriage is over, I'm depressed because I have not had any romantic offers while he has moved on with no problem.

dialog.text: Hello, is someone there?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello, my name is Jonathan. May I ask who I am speaking to today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi Jonathan, I'm Keri.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi Keri. How are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm feeling a little bit down today. I've been feeling a little bit down a lot lately.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My ex-husband is moved in with his new girlfriend. They might get married.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He started dating a few months after we split up. I don't know if this is the only person he's dated but I think so. He really moved on quick.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi, are you still there?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It makes me feel like he didn't learn anything from our relationship or like he thinks he's better than me because he has someone new and I don't. I'm trying to take some time and be alone and be okay with being alone, which is good I think, but sometimes I feel really really lonely too. Like maybe I won't ever find anyone.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That must feel really isolating. But working on yourself and becoming a better you is the only way to move on in a healthy manner. I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. I am guessing from your name that you identify as male (please forgive me if that is incorrect), so you might not understand what it feels like to be an older woman when your ex starts dating someone a lot younger. Men only get better and more desirable with age, not so for women.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I might not understand that particular aspect, but self worth is still self worth no matter the context. I'd say try not to pay any mind to what he's up to. The grass always looks greener on the other side of the fence, but if you just focus on watering your grass (making yourself happy) then you'll have a much more fulfilling life.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Haha, watering my own grass. That is a good way to put it. Thank you for talking to me for a few minutes. It makes me feel a little bit better to have someone agree that it is okay to spend time working on me, instead of thinking that it is sad or pathetic or an excuse. I really appreciate it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh absolutely Keri. Thanks for opening up and sharing your experience and feelings with me for just a few minutes. It was great to talk to you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have a good night, Jonathan. :-)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Happy Holidays Keri. Keep your head up!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Happy holidays.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I'm disgusted that the professors don't see me as a human with real emotions and feelings.

dialog.text: How can I help you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm disgusted with my professors that they don't see me as a human with real emotions and feelings.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand that you are feeling like your professors don't see you as a person with feelings. What happened to make you feel this way?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have testing all the time and study non-stop, but the professors don't seem to encourage or support me.  They just see me as a number I feel.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: tough it out.

dialog.text: That sounds like a good idea.  Maybe they are feeling this way too.

dialog.text: Also sometimes just stepping back and taking some deep breaths can help to alleviate some anxieties. Have you tried that ever?

dialog.text: That is reassuring that it worked before for you and  can work again.

dialog.text: I'm so worried about failing because I just don't feel the support from my professors to care either way for my successes.  It's so different from high school and home when my parents encouraged me and supported me full-heartedly.

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I was a  part of a religious group in college and they were very supportive even praying for me on exam days.  I felt they helped me with my success by planting seeds of positive feedback to me.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I used to be part of one during high school years, and that sounds like it would help.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are you starting to feel better about the situation?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I do thinking about other people filling in the gaps and supporting me when others won't or can't. Thanks for chatting.  This was helpful.

dialog.text: I think I have a few tools now to make things better.

situation: I have lost my job, and my entire industry has been shut down due to Covid-19, and I am struggling to find work that is safe for me to do from home.

dialog.text: Hey, how are you doing?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not the best, but I'm surviving.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: hello?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: By surviving, is it more of a personal situation or an outside dilemma affecting you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I just haven't been able to find any work. I guess that is an outside dilemma, but being this behind on bills and feeling this helpless to change my situation has negatively impacted my mood.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I see what you mean. Finding work in this environment can be stressful as well. In any case, I can say that a good way to start is to account for all transactions you make.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have already been budgeting extensively, the issue is I can't make enough to cover my basic expenses, no matter how much I cut them
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are you also pressed for time? Time management can be a predicament as well.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have lots of free time, just waiting for unemployment to respond to my claims, applying for jobs online, and trying services like mturk to earn what I can from home in the meantime.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I spend a good portion of my day trying to apply for everything I can and fixating on mturk tasks to make me feel like I'm accomplishing something
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Wow, it's slightly uncanny the way our situations are similar. For someone who is also not in the best place financially and just making the bare minimum, it can feel hopeless sometimes.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know you are feeling stressed at the moment, but I've realized focusing on the long term helps ease the pressure of current stressors.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I get to a point in my day where it feels like I've done everything I can for that day, and then I just have to try not to get too stir crazy.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I feel that if you can focus on using your extra time as an investment into yourself (whether by reading, picking up a hobby, or working out), you can feel more accomplished and at ease with what you are doing in life.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've been trying to look ahead, but this year has already set me back so much from my intended career path that it's frustrating. I just want my life back.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is good advice. I have been doing a lot more art during this time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being progressive is difficult, but is one of the things in life which compound very easily. I believe many aspects in life are connected and that improving in some parts improves you as a whole
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Some days it's tempting to just do nothing and wait for it all to be over, but I feel better when I accomplish something for the day
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And if these "improvements" can also make you money/increase your worth/ease your mind, then that can be called a success. In my opinion atleast.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I wish someone was interested in buying my art! That would be a huge confidence boost
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah, but imagine how it would if you had days like that knowing it isn't a bad thing to relax. You have already put in the work in being comfortable before, allowing to enjoy your time however way you wanted.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Looks like you already have an interest which can help you in many ways in life. That's really good.
