situation: Worried about my daughter abd her academic struggles. She has a genetic condition and some learning differences. Struggling to cope to work and do day to day things and give her as much support as she needs.

dialog.text: Hello. How are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi, I'm struggling today.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that. Anything in particular that is bothering you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I just feel worn out with everything I have to do.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I don't know what else I can d to help my daughter.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand that you are feeling worn out and don't know what else you can do to help your child. Is there something specific going on or is it just life in general?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My daughter struggles with school work and memory. She learns differently and needs lots of support. I have contacted the school a number of times over the years but never really had any support or acknowledgement from them. I guess it's just an accumulation of things.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You have tried hard to help her and that is admirable. Don't beat yourself up and be proud of the things you have done for her.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But what do I now. She's 17 and it's so difficult to give her the time and then  encourage her to tell me when she needs help and for her to be willing to accept it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: While I do not have kids, from what I have seen my friends and family do in this situation is try to find something that your daughter is interested in and attempt to build off of that. So instead of her learning to just learn, she is learning something that is relevant to her. Maybe that might spark something in her to come up with her way of learning since traditional methods aren't working.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is great advice. She does climb and hasn't been able to climb or see her friends with everything closed. I think as she will be able to again soon may be that will help her to relax and get back into it. She does learn through repetition but has lacked enthusiasm especially in the last few months.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Having her go climbing more sounds like a good plan. Hopefully things are opening up around you now that the vaccine is becoming more common.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Repetition is tough. I know I used a lot of flash cards as a way of learning through high-school and college. It's an old method but it can work.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: She had heart  surgery as a baby so has actually had the vaccine herself as she's in the vulnerable category.  I think she ends up spending so long making aide memoires that she then leaves herself so little time to actually study.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can imagine after having heart surgery as a baby she wants to live life to it's fullest extent and prioritizes making memories over school. Does she ever talk about what her plans are for after high-school? At some point she will have to connect the dots of having to get a job to be able to go out and have fun, and unfortunately doing OK in school comes with that. That or a vocational school to learn a trade (what I personally did).
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What did you do? Her interests are music and photography. Recently she has started a gardening club with the horticulture department at school. She does enjoy her social life well when she has been able to have it. She has had social ups and downs but apart from the epidemic she has been happier than in her earlier years at school. You are right she is becoming an adult and will find her place. At 17 I guess she doesn't have to decide just yet.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You have certainly made me feel a bit more positive.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sorry for the delay. I am glad you are feeling more positive. I was into cars so I went to vocational school to become an auto mechanic. After a couple years of that I realized I wasn't cut out for physical labor and went to college. But the knowledge from working on cars helped me understand things better at college since I had real world applications I could use it on.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Gardening and Horticulture is a great hobby! That definitely could cross over into some of her science classes to make things more interesting and relevant to her.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you so much for your time and kindness today. You helped me refocus and some of the things you said were just what I needed to hear.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Glad I was able to help. Sometimes just having someone to bounce things off of makes a big difference. You have a good heart and good intentions. I wish you and your daughter the best.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you.  Take care :-)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You're welcome. It was my pleasure.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Please hit the quit button and take the survey. I can not end the chat from my side. Thank you!

I would say, the things that work best for me, are to take breaks during my work day and go for walks or as soon as I'm done with work I force myself to go for a walk. dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sure! :)

dialog.text: Wow, I just did the breathing technique and I do feel more relaxed. Thanks for the advice!

dialog.text: That's Great! Best wishes for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you, best to you as well.

situation: I am depressed about Covid and being restricted from going places.

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is very rough. Have you considered joining internet communities so you can at least talk with people who are in the same situation?

dialog.text: I feel very understood and validated.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It feels great to be able to help people. I really wish you all the best in the coming weeks and months. Enjoy the rest of you day!

dialog.text: I want to speak with them because they are in good nature
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Maybe you could chose a place to meet that is neutral, somewhere at a park or at a cafe. You can ask them to reflect on the good memories in your friendship and then express how you value them as people and friends. Does that sound like something you can try?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, i want to do some moderate friendship with them
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a good idea too. Having boundaries is the healthiest part of a relationship so that neither party gets taken advantage of. Setting up lines not to cross is a great idea.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I want to do some help to them but i don't do expect more from them
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand that friends can disappoint us sometimes and friendships can take a lot of effort. I would recommend starting a journal. A daily journal can help you express your feelings on paper and it can help you from getting to frustrated and keeping your feelings inside.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, some disappointments show us about real face of friends, so it was an experience to me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am proud of you today because you reached out and have tried to find help outside of yourself. You are growing and trying to do your best.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sure, it is my new way of relationship to me with others
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, you're growing and trying to do your best and wanting to expand your boundaries and make them clear. You have taken the right approach and are on the best track to having a successful relationship in the future. Great Job! Thank you for sharing your story with me today.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Great, thank you friend
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are welcome and here for you anytime. I am able to listen and do my best to help you navigate friendships and other issues too. We are always here.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I was homeless. I had to leave a place I loved. It was mentally a bad state.

dialog.text: Hello, how are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do not know what to do. I feel like shit.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Okay try not to worry. Can you tell me a bit about why you feel so bad?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I got kicked out of the home I was living in.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Wow I am really sorry. Were you living with family, or with friends?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I lived in a rented room.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you were thrown out from a place you were renting? Did you do anything wrong?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No. The renter said he just wanted me out. He also charged me ninety extra dollars.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Wow that is illegal. Do you know that there are organisations that can help you with this sort of thing?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No. I did not. I asked my exboyfriend at the time for advice. He just say to pay him and move.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that that was bad advice to be honest. I think that you are being ripped off. Do not worry, there are things that you can do about it!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is reassuring. I would like action to be taken for justice.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are definitely entitled to it. Do you have somewhere else to live in the meantime?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have a couch to crash on. Another guy said I could store my furniture in his basement. But no official room.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It's a precarious position to be in, especially during a pandemic. Do you have any family members who might help?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I could call my mother. She has a room to stay in. But I only have the money to drive to her home, not the money for a rental truck to move all my stuff.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Would any family members be prepared to loan you money or a vehicle?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I could ask my aunt to use her car, she has an SUV, where as I drive a sedan.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: How much stuff do you have that needs to be moved?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Queen bed, bed frame, small desk, roll chair, bookshelf, rug, boxes of kitchen stuff, etc.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Try not to worry too much - I was in this position once myself and it did all turn out for the best though it was very scary at the time.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I feel almost numb from the depression. Like non of my stuff matters, only that I am physically safe.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it would be a good idea for you to try and get medical help for your depression.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I agree. Asking for help is a plan.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I wish you all the very best with it - there is help out there!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Enjoy the rest of your day :)
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: My boyfriend just told me that he wants to break up because he doesn't see a future because he never wants to get married but I do.

dialog.text: Hello there, how are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi, Thanks for talking to me today. I've been so upset about my boyfriend breaking up with me.  It was so unexpected.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that. When did he break up with you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He texted me yesterday!  Can you believe that?  We've been together a year and he broke up with me by texting me!!!  He couldn't even do it face to face!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That seems very cowardly to break up with you over text after being together for a year.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I thought so too!  He knew I'd be upset and he didn't want to deal with me I guess.  He knew I wanted to get married some day from the very start.  He knew it didn't have to be soon.  I'm still in college.  I just want to know that he wants marriage some day but he decided that marriage is an institution he doesn't believe in.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a shame. I can understand his perspective if marriage is not something he wanted but it seems hurtful to string you along in  a relationship if your life goals were very different. Was your differing opinions on marriage the only reason he gave?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, It was completely unexpected because things with us were going great.  I was completely blindsided.  We hadn't even talked about marriage lately.  He just knew that it was something that I wanted in the future.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That sounds very difficult. How have you been coping with the break up?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've just been crying and laying in bed.  I called off work today.  I don't want to see anyone right now.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think this is to be expected from a very fresh break-up. I know that when I broke up with my partner, I spent at least a few days crying and trying to figure out what my life would be now.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How 'd you get over it?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I tried to focus on other areas of my life and to critically reflect on my relationship. Largely, I threw myself into my work and tried to better that aspect of my life, and hung out with people that I knew cared about me. Both of those are very good distractions which you might be able to use.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Maybe calling off work was a bad idea...  all I'm going to do is think about this instead of doing something to take my mind off of it...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think one day off to get the crying out of your system is a good emotional cleanse. We all need time to self care and look after our emotions. Maybe going for a walk or doing some yoga, to place your focus on something rather than being boxed into a room may help to shift your focus.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think I'm going to get out of bed and do something to take my mind off of this .  Thanks for chatting with me today!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think I'm going to do that!  There is a park by my house that I'm going to go for a walk in!  Some fresh air might be good for me!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are more than welcome. I hope that you feel better by being outside.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks!  I hope so too!
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: i have depression because recently i lost my job

dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm in depression because recently i lost my job

I was blindsided and very upset and felt depressed also. I started looking for jobs and found a better one that paid more, so it worked out for the best in the end.

Do you have any family that can be supportive to you through this difficult time?

dialog.text: do you have any idea for getting new job?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would recommend looking for an local group that help assist creating new resumes. Nonprofits have people who volunteer.

dialog.text: Thanks for sharing your ideas
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You're welcome, I would also suggest reaching out to your friends and family for support during this challenging time. You are a faithful employee and have a great future ahead.

dialog.text: yes they are supporting but its difficult situation
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You can always reach out to me and I can providing  you a place to vent and express yourself and the feelings that you are having. Hopefully you feel like a plan to begin apply for new jobs is a start forward.

dialog.text: thank you so much for you support , i fell better
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you for being so strong and reaching out today. Have a great rest of your day.

dialog.text: thanks
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would be happy to continue if you have anything else you would like to say and of not kindly use the feature to finishing this session.

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you, the feature is provided to you and you alone. The button is for you to confirm you have finished and quit the session and would like to continue with your day. However, I am happy to talk as long as you are if you don't want to do that, I am unable to on my end.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: sorry is your side
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: ok
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I have been feeling kinda down lately since my pet died. I miss her so much.

dialog.text: Hello how is your day today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hello. Not so good.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I lost my cat recently. It surely feels... overwhelming at times.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a very hard thing to be going through where you very close to your cat?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I had her for 11 years.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She died of natural causes.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I lived alone with her. The house feels extremely empty now...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am very sorry to hear that i have also lost a pet earlier this year his name was fish and was only 3 years old he unfortunately passed due to liver cancer. It was a very trying experience but slowly the pain of his passing has got a little bit easier.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you tried talking about this loss to friends of family?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No. My family lives in another country, and I really don't have any close friends.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What have your feelings been like after the passing of your cat?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I feel hopeless. Alone. I feel like a chunk of myself passed along with her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Those are completely valid feelings to have at this time
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you considered getting a small reminder of your cat perhaps a small shrine or tribute to him/her?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Her I apologize for the confusion.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No. I fear that things like that may remind me of her and make me feel worse.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Expressing your emotion is very healthy for example maybe taking up a new hobby or trying something new that scares or excites you to get your mind off of this difficult time.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I used to play videogames before. Now I'm not so sure I would enjoy them.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What was your favorite genre of video games?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: First person shooters and MMORPG's.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you considered playing again possibly joining an online team and competing in tournaments?
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I am very scared about next college semester it is frightening

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there, how can I help you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I would like some help with the problem I am facing
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: OK, sure. Can you tell me what the problem is? I'll do my best to help.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well I am going into my next college semester next month, and I am very frightened about a calculus class I have to take. It's an honors course and I am very worried that I will not do well
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can understand that. It must be an important exam for you. Do you enjoy calculus?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm terrible at anything with numbers, myself!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't remember, I took an easy calculus course in high school but that was a couple years ago. I only got a B there, so I'm worried about taking an honors one. I have to take it for my degree goal
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: A B is a great result!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Are there any revision courses that you can access to help refresh your skills?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't think so, the campus is closed due to the pandemic. There are a few online tutors but they are almost always busy
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: This pandemic has really made it difficult to get anything done hasn't it.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you know of anyone else who is looking to take the course that you got revise together with?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I always find it easier to work through things like this with someone else.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes the pandemic has affected many of my friends and their families, very difficult these times are.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No, none of my friends are taking the class/ none of them have ever taken calculus
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: There seem to be some really good online courses out there. It might be worth sending out enquiries to a number of tutors, asking them to get in touch as soon as they are free, and in the meantime working through something online to help build up your confidence?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That sounds like some good advice to me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Maybe I'll try working on it for my confidence like you said
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I bet once you get into it again it will all come back to you. Sometimes getting started is the hardest part.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think you're right!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you believe in me? That I will pass well?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that if you got a B once, you can do it again, and if you really want it, which you clearly do, you can do anything! Aim for an A, you can do it!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you very much you've been very helpful
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: God bless you have a good day
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And you too, good luck!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: My partners and I are not on the same terms. Need some emotional support.

dialog.text: HI
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is anyone there?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there I am so sorry
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: was a little distracted but I am here.  How are you feeling?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, it's a weird story. I am feeling very sad about it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that the person just changed over time. We grew apart.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear that.  Do you want to tell me the story? I promise it won't be weird. I've been through a lot.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh yeah?  Was this a friend, partner, family member?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My boyfriend just stopped communicating with me. It's like he lost interest in me and moved on.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Breakups are the worse around the holidays. It was around Thanksgiving last year. Have you ever been through a breakup during the holidays?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am so sorry to hear that.  Have you tried anything to address the situation?  Perhaps bringing it up to him subtlly?  Or even just asking how HE is, to see if he has siomething he wants to talk about.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh goodness, yes.  I actually was ghosted by the woman I thought was my soulmate... on my birthday.  It was... strategic of her.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I tried to call, text, and email him but he never responded. I just accepted it as he just moved on, and I had to do the same.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear about your girlfriend. That must have been hard to experience your breakup on your birthday.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you haven't heard from him since the end of November?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, he just totally cut off all communication. I don't know whether or not he is safe or anything.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there a family member or trusted friend you could reach out to?  Has he logged into or posted on any of his social media accounts?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We never went out on a date or anything. It was just strictly communicating my phone, text, and email. It was kind of weird, like he was hiding something. I don't know about any of his friends or family. He does not have any social media accounts.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is he close to you or is this a long distance type thing?  Just for context's sake. No judgment of course.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It was more of a long distance relationship. It is far to love from a distance though.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It is hard to love from a distance-- sorry.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, it can also be... easier to open up to someone and the relationships can be very intimate, even from a distance.  So your feelings are valid, 100%.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes. It was nice talking to you. I am about to sign off. Have a great day!
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I am battling with letting my past childhood trauma effect my relationship and the raising of my child.

dialog.text: Hello.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am battling with my childhood trauma that i feel is affecting my everyday life with my child and spouse. I don't know how to tell my spouse about my childhood in fear he doesn't want to be with someone with a upbringing such as mine.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi, thank you for chatting with me.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: From what I understand, you are struggling with childhood trauma and this is affecting everyday life with your child and spouse.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, correct. I am not sure how to tell my spouse about my childhood trauma. He wants to know. He wants to help me. But I am not sure where to begin with explaining it to him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a really hard situation to be in, but I know that you can have that conversation with your spouse!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Does he have any idea about any of the trauma you have experienced?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am worried it will effect his views on me. And he has a very rough idea of things that have happened.. he tells me he wants to know everything so he can help me move forward.. but when i try to talk about it i ramble and end up not explaining anything. I have even tried writing it down.. and nothing seems to work.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Just listening to you talk I can tell this is something that is making you extremely anxious.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: very much so.. whenever it gets brought up i free and begin to ramble and i think it makes him overwhelmed ..
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: One thing I would suggest is after writing everything down that you rehearse it for a while in front of a mirror and picture that you are talking to your husband while you are doing this.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He had a very different childhood then myself. Almost complete opposite then myself. And I have tried... i cant seem to get my self to even put my past down on paper...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: When I have tried to i end up sending my self into a panic.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you reached out to other people or a group of people who may have experienced the same type of trauma you have?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No.. i do not know many people fro my area. As soon as i was able to leave where i grew up i packed up and left. We live in a extremely rural area where there is not many new faces.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have also experienced childhood trauma in my past and it was extremely hard to get through. I found talking to people who went through the same thing helped a lot.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Maybe i will have to look int finding support group in my area...thank you very much!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: After speaking with others in the same situation, I was able to convey this to my loved ones in a better way and I was much more comfortable with it,
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thank you for your help!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are very welcome! Thank you for chatting with me today!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You did a great job!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am glad I could help, if you ever need anything else don't be afraid to contact us back!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Anyway I hope that I have been able to help you a little and that you are feeling a little more positive about things?

situation: I'm addicted to marijuana and cannot stop consuming it on a daily basis.

dialog.text: Hello there, how are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am doing well. My marijuana consumption today has been less than what it has been for the last week.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well that is good. Are you trying to come off it completely?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Absolutely not. I'm not even in California yet, where I know my usage will explode. It's just difficult managing the realities of quarantine with the effects of the marijuana
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, do you worry about your consumption? If you don't I don't see it as a problem :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, because of the financial strain it places on me and my wife, who is also a regular user.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ah yes, it is not cheap. I am not sure how much to suggest as it's not legal in my country :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It was recently legalized in our state. My wife and I were actually one of the first people in line to buy it legally last year, before the pandemic. It is a major part of our lives.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am in the UK. It's sort of a grey area ... police won't really do anything but you can't buy it over the counter
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: One of the best things about legalization has been the expurgation of criminal records for incarcerated people jailed on marijuana charges. I'm very grateful that these atrocities have been rectified at least partially.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes I would be too. Even twenty five years ago in my student days it was rare for anyone to be prosecuted for pot.  The US seems to be really strict on it tho

dialog.text: How are you tiday?

dialog.text: I'm good, anything I can help you with?

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: oh no... I'm sorry to hear that.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you talked to anyone about this?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank youu

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: and feeling entitled

dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I don't love my partner any more and I don't know what to do for the best as she really loves me but it's not working.

dialog.text: Hello! How are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've been better to be honest. I think I need to break up with my girlfriend but she moved in last year and I don;' know how to approach it. I think I'm going to be in for a bad emotional time
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That seems like a tough situation! What feelings made you decide you need to breakup with her?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's a bit of a mix. I don't find her attractive that much any more and I think that's important. Also since moving in she is difficult to live with. I can't see myself with her long term.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I completely understand that. I recently broke up with my boyfriend earlier this year, because I didn't feel like I loved him as much as I used to. Things like that are important!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How long have you guys been together?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's good that you have had a similar experience and understand what I'm going through. We dated for a while. The thing is she is Italian and has moved countries to live with me. I feel so bad that this has happened.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh I see. That's a huge step to make in a relationship. So you are hesitant to break up with her because she moved just to be with you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you communicated with her about your concerns? Such as being difficult to live with?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes that's right, I helped her get a job and thought I'd just see how it goes. Her family loves me and thinks I'm great which makes this even more difficult. We have talked about things yes but she sees it as a bit of a joke I think.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it's great that we got matched up, because I went through also the exact same situation. My boyfriend and I were long distance, and he moved across the country to be closer to me. So when I felt like we needed to break up, I was experiencing similar guilt that you are experiencing.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's great that you understand this. I think being the man puts more pressure on me to look after her and make sure she
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: she's safe etc
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I want to reassure you, that doing what's best for you is what is most important! Your partner will understand this if they truly care for you. Things will be tough for a while, but you both will be able to grow from this experience. And just because you don't want to be in a relationship anymore, doesn't mean that you don't care about her!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Staying friends after the fact might take the pressure off of you a little bit. You can still help her out and be there for each other, but as friends instead of partner's.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: To be honest, it's amazing that you have suggested this. It's really hard to balance my needs and feelings without breaking her heart. It's hard for the person that's dumped but actually I think it is equally hard for the dumper!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes exactly! It's so difficult for the dumper as well, because of course you still have strong feelings for this person. They just aren't romantic anymore.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: And that is okay. You don't need to feel guilty for things that you can't control. You can still be there for her without pretending to be in love
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's exactly it. So do you think I should just talk to her and tell her how I feel? The thing is it's not like she can move out immediately. It's going to be a long drawn out experience.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think talking to her and being transparent about your feelings is definitely the right move. In doing this, reassure her you still want to be friends and you aren't just "kicking her to the curb." Things will obviously be awkward for the first little bit, because continuing to live together will bring it's own difficulties. But the beautiful thing about that is, you guys are already used to it. :) So it's only hard if you make it hard
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I think I need to emphasize the friends element of it and potentially support her to move on. I suppose I'm fearful that it will never end but I'll need to face into that and stay strong, and obviously avoid being intimate as this would really hurt her if I continued to sleep with her. I need to be careful about that I think!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes exactly. And from chatting with you, I can tell that you are a very caring person. You don't want to hurt her. I believe that you have the understanding of the situation, and you know what you should and shouldn't do in order to make it work. The hard part is simply getting the courage to finally discuss it. But I think you are going to be able to do that just fine!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I must say, you have been fantastic to talk to about this, we have had a similar experience so I think the advice is coming from experience. Thanks for that!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What I've gathered about you as a person, makes me confident that you probably chose a partner that will be able to have this talk with you and you both will come to an understanding.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes I think it's very great we were able to connect on our issues! It definitely helps. You are welcome! :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for a great conversation. To continue as is wouldn't be fair on her and I see that now.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course! And it wouldn't be fair to her, just as much as it wouldn't be fair to you. Your happiness is just as important!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, I need to put myself first but also be considerate of her feelings. Thanks for that
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Take care and enjoy your day.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course! I'm glad that you are feeling a bit better about everything! You as well!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: COVID-19 made me lose my beautiful job which I admire a lot and I am searching for another one which is not fort coming. Please what can I do now?

dialog.text: Good evening! I am good

situation:
Cause of the covid, I have problems with study and communication. 
I have problem in my University, also problems how to communicate with people after 1 year, of lockdown.

dialog.text: Hello.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello, glad to meet you virtually. How are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Im doing fine. What about you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am good.  How may I help you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have problem with the communication. One of the main problems, is that Im not sociable person, so I dont have a lot of friends, and the situation with Covid, just finished me. Now, I'm siitin at my home, just playing game and study. How can I start to communicate with people?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Or to meet the new peoples?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I completely get that.  I am thinking that most people are feeling isolated therefore communication with others are feeling even more challenging thank usual.  Playing games can certainly help.  What type of games do you play?  Perhaps there are people that share the same interests
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: For example, the games that I'm playing are: Call of Duty, League of Legends. Yes it's multiplayer game, where can communicate throught the discord or voice, but I'm making a lot of cringe staff, that takes away new playes/friends.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I guess, it cause of my fears, that I can miss the new friends.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Multi player games help I would assume.  Do you play with people you actually know sometimes?  I am sure that you make a great friend so we can explore areas of meeting new people,  I can tell you that I am not having the easiest time keeping up with friends and I am certainly not meeting new people in person very often myself.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Almost, I play solo. Yeah, I undertsand your message. You said right things.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Okay so perhaps play with people as opposed to solo.   Do you think it would be worth a try?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I need to try it. I guess it's one of the best way to solve my problem. Thanks
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are quite welcome.  Perhaps I can play as well.  Is it easy to catch on or are the games you play difficult?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yh, it kinda difficult, cause need to know some staff, before you play it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Got it! Do you play sports or any other activities where you encounter people?
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I lost my job recently, and it has been very difficult to keep paying my bills.

dialog.text: Hi
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there, how are you feeling today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Quite bad. I tried to send some job applications but there are still no reply.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hear you. It's been a terrible year all round for job seekers, given the global situation at the moment. I have been there myself.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Can you give me some advice on how to cope with this?  I honestly don't know what to do.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, firstly I think you need to accept that this is not your fault and that at the moment the world situation is beyond your control.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I understand, but still, emotionally it is hard to cope.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are you able to cope financially whilst you are out of work?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Perhaps you could  take on some gig work just to earn a little extra spare cash?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not really, my savings are running out. I am doing some part-time freelance work but it won't pay all the bills.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you have any suggestions?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand. I have been in the same situation and I know how frightening it is. Have you though of consulting agencies such as food banks that can help you temporarily?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I haven't been to food banks yet. I can still deal with food on the table for now, but a couple more months without job then I might have to.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you feel that you can at least manage for a few more weeks?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Financially yes. It is just that my emotion is getting worse and worse. Stress I guess.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it might be a good idea for you to consult your doctor? It sounds as though you might be suffering from depression.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't know. Psychologist appointments are very expensive in my country.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And without a job I do not have any insurance.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear that. I have had therapy but it is free in my country. Are there any charities that might offer a limited amount of counselling time?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have not heard of charities that does that. If I am suicidal, may be, but I guess they are not dealing with stress from normal job seekers...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Would you be prepared to take on a job that is outside of  your normal field and income bracket, just temporarily?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I would. I work as an IT consultant before, but I would take any job for now.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I know that it is very difficult with so many businesses being forced to close. Would you be prepared to do delivery work, perhaps?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you mean like food delivery?  like UberEats?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes. Or most restaurants are offering take out services at the moment so there will be delivery services out there
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I guess I could try that, not sure it pays well enough.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: But thank you for your help.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are most welcome. I hope that things will pick up come the new year and you can get back to your regular profession! Just try to think of this as a stop gap
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I hope so as well.  Thank you a lot for advice, I feel better just talking about it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am glad to have been of help .. enjoy the rest of your day!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You too, hope you have a good day.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You have to end it from your end .. I can't :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I see, alright, see you then!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: just hit quit and take the survey :)
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Trying to get my own small crafting business off the ground.

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How are you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sorry I was temporarily distracted. Is there anything that you'd like to talk to me about?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am okay thanks. How is life treating you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's ok.  I am trying to get my crafting business off the ground.  I'm just stressed.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It is a very hard time to get a new business going, isn't it? Are you having problems due to the pandemic?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have also been having financial woes at this time.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No just keeping motivated.  I sell wreaths but I'm switching more to tumblers (just easier storage wise).
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well it's great that you've got a business venture! Do you have experience with this sort of thing?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have sold wreaths for awhile but I did not have time to be as serious so I did not sell a ton.  Now it's time to kick it up and get tings moving.  Be more serious about it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That sounds like an excellent idea to me! I think that you are definitely doing the right thing.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you looked into organisations that might help small business owners like yourself? There are some out there
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I need more motivation, time and energy.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have not but that's a good idea
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Alas I think that we all do at the moment - I am struggling myself to find those things.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I feel like I need more hands/arms too.  If I was like an octopus I'd be good lol
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: LOL so you feel like you just don't have enough help to complete all your orders? Could you hire an assistant?
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Had to work till 11pm and up early the next morning. No emotional support and completely drained of all energy. Have no desire to continue with the job, but need to get paid.

dialog.text: Hi! How are you tonight?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Im ok - tired. Yourself.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm doing fairly well, Thanks. Can I encourage you or support you in some way?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes - definitely. I am not sure how to proceed or what to do in my situation. I am exhausted, mentally and physically.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You sound as if you are in a slump. I've been there. Perhaps defining the problem and some solutions can help?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Perhaps - i dont know the solution. the problem is I cannot continue to work these hours - it is just not sustainable.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What are your hours?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: like generally, or currently in these situations? usually its around 9-5 (give or take).  These days its 9 - 7 or 11pm or later.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have to say, when I am physically and mentally exhausted, I don't think as clearly and lose hope more easily.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: right, and that is the issue of where I am at.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: 9 to 11 would exhaust me. That is 14 hours?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah - something like that. and lunches are at the desk - as i am working from home - so its pretty much no breaks either.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would certainly agree with you. That kind of work is unsustainable. Let me ask you this. What would happen if you told your employer you simply could not do these hours?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: hah - i dunno. im on a team of 2 people - and i guess if i dont do it, the other person has to. or it just doesnt get done, and i dont know what happens?? nothing? LOL.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: The worst that could happen is that they fire you. But that doesn't seem too likely as they seem to need you. But I have learned in life that if I don't care for myself, hardly anyone does. We need to be kind to ourselves. Set boundaries.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: agreed - i dont think they would fire me, maybe get reprimanded or more likely a guilt trip as to why I cant do it. Im just not sure what kind of boundaries I set when we have things due, and just literally no time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Setting boundaries can be difficult if you haven't done that a lot. When we think we don't have the ability to say NO, then we feel trapped, worn out, depressed, taken advantage of. People need to know that we reasonably can say no.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well, I have to set boundaries, because working till 11pm most nights is not sustainable. and who on earth is going to view, let alone sign a contract at 12am
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that would be the first step. Determine how many hours you feel you COULD work. Then advise them that is what you will do. Find out what kind of timelines there are, and if you can't do it, don't go beyond your boundaries. It is obviously destroying your life. It really isn't healthy for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Exactly. It isn't working for you. Something has to change. And you sound intelligent, so you can determine what will work for you -- perhaps a range of hours, but definitely not 14 hours. Unless you are a young kid. lol Even then, that's a lot.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah - ill come up with reasonable boundaries till 5:30 is reasonable, and if its a do or die situation cap it at 7:30 --- and thats only for dire situations. if that doesnt work, well then i guess either i dont have a job, or people figure out how to work in regular hours.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That sounds reasonable to me. And if they try to make you feel guilty, reject that. Tell them, I'm sorry, but I feel this is reasonable, and truly it is.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: hah i used to go out like a young kid, but still - just because most of us are working from home 24/7, doesnt mean I actually can work 24/7. even fi i were young, hell no. they dont pay me enough.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: thanks i really appreciate it. it sounds reasonable, and its what a coworker told me. if i dont set boundaries, i will crack.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No one can work 24/7.  I think they may not even be aware you are struggling. So communication is important.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You don't want to crack. It's not worth it.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah, i think a call to not just my boss is in order, but also HR to advise them of the situation. they need to start telling managers, we are NOT front of the line workers, nor police, fire, etc. our jobs are not THAT important.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I will say a prayer that you communicate your needs politely but firmly. And not believe false guilt. As you said, you aren't putting out fires and doing CPR.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: plus netflix, hulu, amazon keep releasing new shows. if i need a reason, it can simply be to watch tv and detox (so to speak) and get away from the BS of work (obv stating it more nicely than that).
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I fear my child is in bad company. Recently his behavior has changed to the worst. I don't know how to approach the issue.

dialog.text: Hello my name is Sharon, how are you today? :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi Sharon. Am good just concerned about my son.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh I see.  What's happening with your son?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I suspect my son is in bad company. His most recent behaviour is so different from what I am used to
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh that's hard to deal with.   My daughter ran with a bad crowd for a while and I remember the deep worry.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What sort of behaviour are you noticing?  How old is he?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My son is 15. Recently he's keeping to himself and mostly stays locked in his room. He barely allows anyone in.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And when you try and talk to him about it what does he say?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He says he's studying online. But I suspect he's doing other stuff online apart from study
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh I see.  Apart from isolating how is he doing otherwise, like at school?  Is he still seeing his friends at all?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It can be scary not knowing what our kids are up to online.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not really. He just has this one particular friend who comes over sometimes and they lock themselves in the room.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hmm.  So a lot of mystery.   I can understand you being worried.   Is he your only child?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am so scared I don't want to confront him I have always tried to show him how much I trust him as away to make him feel responsible enough
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes. He is my only child and I am single parent
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thats good parenting!   Perhaps if you frame it as being about you, e.g. "I am getting really worried, can you please explain....it's affecting me (affecting my sleep/work/whatever" .... maybe it will inspire him to be more forthcoming
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Any signs of depression?   I have been depresed before, and self-isolating can be a symptom, I've been there...
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Never thought of it that way. That could be a possibility. But he always seems happy and we chat a lot onlythat he his behind closed doors in his room for a long time everyday.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Am also concerned about the friend who comes over. I don't really know his family or home just that he's from the neighborhood and they go to the same school.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hmm.  My other thought is tell him what you just told me, that you have been trying to show him that you trust him....but be honest and tell him you are afraid.   Hopefully, he won't want you feeling that way, and will open up a bit.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes I can see that being concerning when you know nothing about the friend.   Yet you walk a fine line because he needs the freedom and autonomy to choose his friends without explanation required...it's such a balancing act.   I can tell you that I have raised a daughter, and that teen years were tougher than toddlerhood.   Lots of worry, but she came through it and is fine now.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I wonder if there is a teacher he is close to that you could bring your concerns to, perhaps the teacher may have some insight about yoru son to offer?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I find reassurance from your words. Its been tough for me this far we have come with my son and I want us to be close even as he growing up to become a young man. I have a good relationship with their teacher and will definitely give her a friendly call to know more from her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh good.   And it may be just a normal part of his development.   Teens pull away from parents, peer group becomes far more important.  It may be as simple as that.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It took my daughter about 15 years to "come back to me" and now we have a close relationship again....so even if he seems to be drifting away know that it's normal and that will change in the future.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Good to know that from an experienced parent. I will try communicate my worries and my intensions to him. I hope he will understand and not pull away.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And in the meantime remember to take extra good care of yourself :)   Sometimes as moms we forget to do special things for ourselves.   You are doing the hardest and most imporant job in the world so it's important to recognize that and reward yourself for it.   I hope that conversation goes well for you, that you will have with him.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for your time and experienced advise.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh you're so welcome, it's been a pleasure speaking with you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: The pleasure was all mine. Bye.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: bye :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: If you are struggling on finding a way back to your moms house, it might be a good idea to loan or borrow some money from either friends or family, or open a credit card just for the time being. Then once you get back to your mom's, you can start focusing on yourself and get yourself back on your feet! IT's important to not overwhelm yourself right now, so focus on one thing at a time

situation: I am at my first semester in a doctoral program and have a lot to do at once and have been feeling very anxious in the past few weeks.

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Good afternoon!  What can I help you with today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've been feeling a lot of pressure and stress lately due to school
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oof, yes, school can be a tough situation.   Are you close to the end of the semester?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That can be both a relief and stressful, because a break is near, but all the exams and projects are due.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I am a little more than halfway done with the semester
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: The thing is that I am in a doctoral program, so even though the semester is close to the end, I always need to continue working
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ahh, I see.  That is a great deal of time and work.  What are you studying?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It is... I am in psychology
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have to work on my thesis on the side even with all of my classes and I have a hard time managing my time and keeping track
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Time management can be very difficult with a normal class load, that sounds exhausting.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It is!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do calendars help you at all?  I am a super visual person, so calendars and planners are invaluable to me, as well as different colors of ink and labels so I can visually divide my attention
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Getting a million different colors of pens and highlighters changed my organization for the better.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do keep a physical and electronic agenda, but I feel like even if I write down my tasks, I find a way to procrastinate which is what I am having trouble with
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Also, setting clear boundaries for your study/work and relax times may help.  I like to set a timer for, say, 45 minutes, and work/write/read/study for that long, then, I get a 10 minute break.  I'll go outside, refresh my coffee, grab a snack, dance to some music, stretch, then set another timer for 45 minutes, then another break for 10 minutes.  That allows my brain to take a second and refresh from the work.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is actually very helpful, I'll take note of it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it would help to fix break times so I can actually focus on working
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Or, like, today, I woke up and spent half an hour allowing myself to drink my coffee and scroll through Reddit.  Then it was time to work on my group project for 45 minutes, then a break, then I worked again, took a break, went to a class, etc.  Scheduling your breaks can be helpful too so your lizard brain doesn't freak out and go "WE ARE GOING TO BE WORKING FOREVERRRR"
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree!!! That really is helpful, thank you
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: which, for me at least, is where the fatigue sets in.  You're very welcome!  I hope I was helpful.  You seem positive and willing to try new things, and I think you will be successful even if you are tired.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: The pandemic hasn't really helped either
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm always locked in my apartment and staying sitting down in front of my computer all day
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Definitely not.  Everyone's Maslow hierarchy getting knocked out from under them is extremely disconcerting.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hahaha, Maslow, i like it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Like how is a person supposed to study, self-actualize, when we literally don't know what will happen next?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree! I've also been turning to drugs a lot lately due to the situation. Procrastinating makes me feel guilty, and I end my day too early to smoke and focus my mind on something other than studying....
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are there aspects of your study that you dislike, or are you just ready to be done with school?  Little of column A + column b?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hm, I think it has less to do with liking or disliking, and more with starting a very hard and lengthy degree online without any social contact
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ah, yes, that makes sense.  And working from home is infamously hard, again, for lack of boundaries, so in addition to just not seeing people and getting the casual affirmation and confirmation messages on a daily basis of like "hey Jim you did a great job on that spreadsheet" or "Haha Jessica you're so funny", we also are writing papers in our pajamas and bedclothes, which makes it seem interminable.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Ugh exactly
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Listening to lectures while the doorbell is ringing and it's just so strange and we aren't set up to do it.  That's why I'm a big fan of specific spaces in my house since March.  I tried to sit in bed with my laptop and do things but 1. I'm old and it hurts my wrists and 2. my headspace is so completely different from being my computer chair and at my desk.  I try to be really strict about where I do my work., maybe trying to structure that a bit could help you feel a little more in control of the work load and your day's schedule.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree, that makes a lot of sense! Thank you
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You have been a big help today and I really feel listened and understood. I really appreciate it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am very glad to hear that!  You sound motivated to succeed and I think that you deserve to take care of yourself and stay healthy to complete your studies.  It will be hard but it will also be worth it, and you should be proud.  Good luck with everything!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Wow, thank you!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have a great day
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you!  You too!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: They want me to work on a project with them. I agreed to it. Wondering how it will go.

dialog.text: hi
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Good evening, how are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm good
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What can I help you out with tonight?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm a little nervous about accepting the project from my friend
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That sounds like a complicated situation
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: it is
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is the project something you will become responsible for?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: to a degree
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is that a responsibility you want to have, or is it a burden that is being thrust upon you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: both
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, I think if it's truly a responsibility you want, you will work to live up to it as best you can.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I will. It's the best thing for me to do at the moment. I'm very much needed
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's excellent, not many people can say that!  It's starting to sound more and more like an opportunity for you to prove yourself :-)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It will be to say the least. I might have to deal with people I don't like and who don't like me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's an unfortunate part of most group projects, I hate to say.  Interpersonal communication can be so hard.  I have been a project manager in the past, and found that you have to consider Person XYZ did not wake up in the morning and decide to make your life harder.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: And as long as you can keep things polite and professional, everyone gets to go home separately, thankfully!  Haha
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's a good point! lol
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Foster the people around you that can provide you support, be a reliable producer and leader, and you will find that those that don't like you will move on.  And, most importantly, you can only control how you respond/behave.  If someone wants to instigate conflict, that will reflect poorly upon them.

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You can only engage with what abuse and hostility you accept.  If you smile in response, it will make you feel better than if you internalize their aggression.

dialog.text: True.
