situation: I think my girlfriend may be cheating on me but I'm too scared to do anything about it as I don't want her to leave me. I feel ashamed of myself but I can't help it

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Good Afternoon
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How are you doing troday?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am Ok thanks but have an unusual issue. I think my girlfriend may be cheating on me but I'm too scared to do anything about it as I don't want her to leave me. I feel ashamed of myself but I can't help it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being in a relationship with someone when you suspect unfaithful behavior is a rough thing to go through.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes it is but I should be leaving her and moving on. Problem is she is a 9 and I'm a 5 and I love her. Pretty sure she is cheating though so hopefully if I ignore it she may just leave things as they are.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I've dealt with the same problem with my partner more than once. I love him very much and I found him to be a 9 to my 5 as well. However, the question of whether he was cheating or not was destroying my trust in him and everyone else not to mention what self-respect I had... I had to break down and talk to him about it
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What happened out of interest when you had the conversation?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Ignoring this will NOT help things. There is NO relief in pretending a question or concern does not exist.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Like I said the question has arisen more than once. The first time he owned to talking to other women, but nothing more.Since that time, he denies everything.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know. I'm a typical man and I like the feeling when she is on my arm. I feel like the cat that has got the cream. It's superficial and sad I know. I knew this would never last. She is just too attractive for me. Everyone told me Iwas 'punching above my weight' and now they will all be laughing if it ends.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Honestly, its not anyone else's business. IF you're suspicions are in fact correct, then you've got to see that a loving and faithful 5 is better than a heart-breaking 10. However should you find that maybe the devils of insecurities are tricking you into thinking that she's cheating, then remember that what the two of you share o=is FOR THE TWO of you. Its a relationship, not a community project! Even mu advice, albeit in the air to help you best I can. is not more important that what matters most to YOU and HER!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Curiously, why do you think she's cheating?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm almost certain of it, she is super protective of her phone and never used to be. She is always texting and vague when I ask who she is messaging. She goes away with work and when she does she rarely messages me. Recently she said when was going way for a work trip for three nights but when I called her office her colleague said they got back after two.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hmm... So have you two live together?  How long has this kind of behavior persisted? When you ask her about this behavior, how do you present the question and how does she react? Finally, how often do you talk with her about the situation?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's just it. I kind of know she is cheating but I haven't approached it with her because I'm scared see will just leave and I'll be a laughing stock. I suppose I'm a joke either way!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Don't get me wrong, I completely understand why you have suspicions. Really I think anyone would in the same shoes... However, as humans, we tend to either assume the best or the worst of others. There's always a margin of error present as a variable in such situations.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: very true. I suppose I have just assumed at this stage with no real evidence. do you think I should just talk to her?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Forgive me if this comes off as disrespectful... I only want to help you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: not at all. I appreciate your candour.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: But if you feel as though you're a joke regardless, then why stay in a relationship where you're getting hurt? I know that you don't want to lose the beauty but would you not be happier with loyalty?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: All this is tied up with who and I know I'm valuing the wrong things. You are right actually. I think some of this comes from my low self-esteem. having a 9 helps with that. but maybe I need to deal with it directly.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I wholly believe you should gently but steadfastly confront her. I absolutely do not mean to suggest a dispute or argument. That will not help either. Simply ask her about the things that you KNOW aren't acceptable; lying about how long her trip was is one of them. Also, its okay to talk about how that stuff makes you feel, but try not to project your feelings as her fault. I know that it seems like they are... But she didn't MAKE you feel any specific way, even if her ACTIONS influenced how you were already feeling.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That seems like well considered and thoughtful advice thanks for that. What is clear is that we need to have a conversation. Thanks for helping me reach this conclusion.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: Raising grandson and he is being very difficult and not listening.  I also have a lot of medical issues that limit my abilities.  And my grandson's father is no help, he just drops him off and leaves, never asks if need anything or how I am doing.

dialog.text: Hello, how are you feeling today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi to be honest I am very depressed and angry today
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that. What is causing you these feelings?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Since helping to raise my grandson and his dad is not helping, or cares how I am feeling.  My grandson has been really difficult lately and I find myself losing my temper quickly.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that. That sounds like a difficult situation. Have you tried any personal exercises to help you cope with the situation until you find a resolution?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do go to a quiet place and try some deep breathing, but my grandson always comes walking in
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's certainly a difficult situation. Is there no resolution possible with the father of your grandson? I want to make sure that the cause of the depression has properly been addressed by you or someone else.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I try talking to him, but due to my grandson having some disabilities his dad does not really want to be bothered.  I just want my grandson to succeed and be the best he can be
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it's great that you have such care and concern for your grandson. That shows how incredible you are and on behalf of your grandson, I think you are doing a tremendous job. I think you should continue to support him however you can, but it's also important to take care of yourself. Do you have time available for additional self care, or are there any new exercises you can try to try to take care of yourself?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for saying that it means alot having someone tell me I am doing a good job. I recently purchased a hot tub and have been thinking that maybe when he goes to bed I could go out and relax, but have not done that yet
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That sounds like a great start. Self care is vitally important in this difficulty time with COVID and the pandemic. I recommend any little bit of time that you can contribute to yourself, this includes reading, relaxing, meditating, exercise, or just resting. Anything that can help you repair so you are better prepared to help your grandson.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I will try my best to get more time for myself and try to relax more often that I currently am.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am also trying to accept that my medical issues are getting worse and I can not do all that I use to, and that truly frustrates me as well.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think the anger you are feeling is directly a result of the situation? Do you feel the anger is manifested from somewhere else? I think it is important to get to the underlying source of the anger and take care of that first and foremost.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's concerning, but very understandable. Are you able to financially seek additional help? Sometimes it's just what you need, as hard or embarrassing as that may seem. No one needs to know what you seek, but it is important not to disregard additional help, be it mental health, physical therapy, or just general prevention and detection from a PCP.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I feel that I am having trouble dealing with the fact that I am not able to do all the things I want to do.  It is not an easy thing to lose your abilities when you feel so young but your body says otherwise.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I was in physical therapy but could not afford it any longer.  So instead I purchased my own hot tub to be able to soak in and do some water exercises that may help me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that's a normal way to feel and a frustrating part of growing older. I think focusing on positives and things you enjoy will help keep your mind away from thinking about "what used to be" or "what once was" - finding passions and joys in new things could help revitalize you. Can I help you find new hobbies or passions?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think exercise bands are a great way to keep your limbs loose and nimble. They are affordable and available on Amazon. I have some and I think they're great. YouTube can help with exercises.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is a great idea, I may even have some here that I could use.  I am lucky that I do have two dogs that keep me going as well and am trying to get out and take them on walks more, but not easy when is so cold out lately.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Totally understandable. I'm a little younger and even I am sick of sub 50F weather, so that's not age holding you back! I think it's important to maintain positivity and find any outlet that keeps that going for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you I will definalty do that and will look for some additional exercises to do.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You're welcome. Is there anything else I can help you with today, even if it's something as simple as providing suggestions for new things to try?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I would love some additional suggestions!!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Meditation has worked wonder for my best friend. The app Headspace is fantastic. I'd also recommend podcasts, using either and app or your computer, and find a series on a topic that you enjoy, weather it's mindfulness, or self-care. There are plenty to choose from and you can go at your own pace.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Those sound like great ideas, thank you again!!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You're welcome. I hope you find peace within and happiness again. Your grandson will improve with time, it's inevitable! But stay positive, stay focused, and be sure to not take anything out on him as he relies on you and your input. Have a wonderful day!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: A coworker feels that I am discriminating against her because I give corrective feedback on procedures she is doing wrong.  There have been numerous occasions of her wrongdoing.

dialog.text: Hi, how are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I could be better.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sorry to hear. What's going on?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i'm having difficulty dealing with a coworker that doesn't take constructive feedback on standard work procedures well and is now starting her own investigation.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sorry to hear that. An investigation on who? you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Me and my manager. She feels that we are targeting her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's unfortunately. Have you talked to someone in upper management about this?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have talked to him about past issues with her but not this most recent. I'm trying to give myself some time to talk to him because I'm still very angry and don't want to talk with so much emotion
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is understandable. People can be hard to deal with at times. What did the co-worker do that upset you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We have a set process of how we are to screen employees as they enter the workplace.  She doesn't follow the procedures or makes up her own way to do them because she is lazy to either stand up or greet them.  She is also rude at times to customers and has an attitude that is not friendly.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh, that's unfortunate. Have you brought this issue to upper management in the past?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have and so my manager sent a general memo reminding employees about our standard operating procedures.  And from that memo, she thinks it's only about her and that we are discriminating against her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sorry to hear. Has upper management done anything about this issue?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I haven't taken it past my immediate manager but I may have to at this point if she is looking to file a grievance or submit a statement that we are discriminating her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, in my opinion, I think you did the right thing. Has anyone else mentioned her rudeness in the past?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you.  Yes others that have worked with her share say the same thing about her rudeness and laziness on the job.  I am probably going to submit some kind of report or statement to upper management.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I was wondering, how long has she been an employee at your work?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm just unsure because I have not documented the  incidents that I have had with her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She's been employee for approximately 5 months.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No, I think you did the right thing.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Wow, 5 month and she's still there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you.  With everything going on in the world right now, it's frustrating to have to deal with this person also...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, I hope everything works out for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for your help and for listening.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: My mom is stuck in Mexico and I hate she keeps asking me for money.

dialog.text: Hello.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am so upset. It's ridiculous how things keep happening to people around me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I suppose my supporter is not here.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: hello how may I assist you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am just so upset
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It's like things never get better
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear that. I know how you feel.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My mom is in Mexico right now for some ex who got deported. Like come on. It's bad enough she sent money to him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What have you tried in the past to turn things around?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hm. I tried moving on. And it just appears she gets worst
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you are missing your mom?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not really...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She just keeps asking me for mone
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I gave her like 10k for the house she bought and she hasn't done anything back.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh I see my mom has also done this in the past. Sometimes I wonder who raised who?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah. I get that
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She rented it to some guy and left before even getting some decent money
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: so now she is stranded in Mexico with some guy who can't even afford to get her back
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is the worst. I ended up having to cut my mom out of my life.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I wonder if I should do the same...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My grand mother basically gave me a whole speech about how ashamed she is.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sometimes it is for the best to set clear boundries.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But who knows. Apparently my mom said she'll put the house in my name for all these things I did for her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Kind of annoying to be frank.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is Grand mother ashamed of you or her daughter? I feel it should be her ashamed of her daughter.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My grand mother is ashamed of her daughter
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am kind of left with a weird circumstance.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: At least that is a good thing to come out of a bad situation.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Only reason she has a house is because I helped. And if I leave it. Everyone in my family said I would be irresponsible to let my mom lose it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I do not think that would have a reflection on you. It should only reflect on your mom.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, they said they already know my mother is irresponsible.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Instead they suggested I should provide extra financial security to myself or at least some future children.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Grandma already is giving a home and 2 apartments but... I guess I am the only kid. Christ.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My mom lost my om over 100k to be honest. It was crazy growing up to that
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It may be nice to have a bonus house for the future. But even that comes with headaches. In the end you have to do what is best for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah. I guess boundaries are good.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I left her without much help to be honest but I guess just hearing it frustrates the crap out of me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Or sell it now and pocket the money to recoup what was lost.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I would but it isn't even my property
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And mom needs a place to stay... sometimes I wonder if she just wants to be homeless
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So she is just talking circles and not accomplishing what she says?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: More like she keeps talking about doing something crazy like have a police chase
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: and how she doesn't care for anything
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Some people do choose that life to be free of responsibility.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you had a talk with her about seeing a mental health professional, She may be having some issues that would benefit from care.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I tried to baker act her after she tried to call the cops on me randomly
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It ended up them asking dumb questions like if she knows what day it is
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: letting her free
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: somehow ending up with her getting herself hospitalized 2 weeks later for low hemoglobin.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Often police officers are not fully trained in helping mentally ill people, they only access if the person is a danger to themselves or others.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah it sucks
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Tried to get her on disability but they just denied her
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She was brought up with bipolar depression before I was born. She said she just ran out the hospital..
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I don't know how she is just getting the consequences of that now
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: A good first step is taking her to your local mental health provider. Or ask at a major emergency room where this is located as sometimes the places are hard to find.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That was about 30 years ago
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Crazy they didn't stop her
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well I do feel better. Thinking about boundaries. It has been less stressful being so involved.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Without treatment she may just be getting worse.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is good to hear..
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've heard she has a lawyer trying to straighten up the whole disability and treatment thing
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My girlfriend just won't let me stay out of it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Saying my mom has no one and I would regret it if she just does something crazy
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That does make it difficult when a partner encourages you to engage in unhealthy behavior.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah. If it was up to me I would probably just be dead silent
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I suggest talking to your girlfriend about how it makes you feel when she insists you continue a relationship that causes so much pain.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah. That's a good point.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well I think the point about boundaries really stuck with me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I feel so much better now
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It was nice talking to you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You too.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I don't know if I should continue with school right now and I am having a hard time making the decision.

dialog.text: Hello.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello how are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm okay. Facing a tough decision and having a hard time coping.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear that. Would you like to talk about it?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, thank you. I decided to go back to school to finish my BA.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Its great that you decided to go back to school. Are you having trouble selecting a college or something like that?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well now with the pandemic I don't know if it's the right time anymore.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand your concern  given the current pandemic situation. But I have heard some colleges are offering online courses until this pandemic is over. Maybe you can explore in that direction to ease your worries.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm taking online courses right now, and I really don't like it. I much prefer in classroom lecture.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I definitely resonate with the way you feel about online learning. Although difficult it is also important to stay indoors to keep yourself safe. Is there anything that will motivate you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't know. I want to see if I could find classes conducted with Zoom or video.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Maybe you can check with the college if they would consider offering classes over zoom as this is the most preferred mode of instruction.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I will try to do that. If that's my only option right now, then I will have to settle for classes conducted over livestream. I just don't like self-learning.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sounds like a plan and am happy to see that you are sure about what you want.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I just wish it could be the way it was. I was so happy to be back in school and I'm so close to being done.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I too wish everything goes back to the way it was and it will one day. We have to adjust to a slightly new way of living and this would happen if each one of us do our part to break the chain and flatten the curve.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree. I still hate it though.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You can do it, as you said you are almost there. Once you do it you will be very proud of yourself. Believe me this is just a temporary setback and you are doing a great job.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for the words of encouragement. I do appreciate that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am glad I could make you feel better. Is there anything else I can do today for you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No. Thanks for chatting with me.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: A person I was dating broke up with me in a terrible manner.

dialog.text: My boyfriend broke up with me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello there, how are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm very upset.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: He yelled and yelled at me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Your relationship has ended? I am very sorry about that. And your boyfriend ended it?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That was really wrong of him if you ask me. I think you might be better off without him.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, after seeing him act this way I agree
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: He said I was worthless.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have been in this position myself and I know how painful it is but it turned out for the best for me - I now have a great relationship!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well that's good for you, but I'm so mad right now I can't see straight!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Noone has the right to put you down like that. You really are better off without him.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know. I do deserve better. But I was with him a very long time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Can you think of something to do that will take your mind off him?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How long were the two of you together?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: More than a year, but I've known him since childhood.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's what makes me so mad!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: He should not be treating you that way when you've known one another so long!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: All those years of friendship down the drain.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Should I call him?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that you should call one of your girlfriends and suggest you have a movie night. It would make you feel better
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But all of my friends are still friends with him!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And they took his side!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh that is rough. That happened to me too when I broke up with my ex.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How did you get through it?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: They all took his side? Not one took yours?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not one!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I tried to find some new interests. One thing I did was take a salsa class .. that was a great way to meet new people
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm not much of a dancer, but that might be a way to meet new people.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: There are lots of other things you could do. Maybe you could take an evening class in something that interests you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He's a teacher, so taking a class might remind me of him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think also you need to think a bit more highly of yourself and not let idiots like this treat you so badly
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But maybe I deserved it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: he seems to have damaged your self esteem badly
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, he did.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No you did not! Please don't think like that
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm just so angry that I could break something.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And maybe I will do that!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that that is a normal reaction to feeling ill treated. I hope that it will pass soon and am sure that it will.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: There are a lot of therapy groups available that might be able to help you through this
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But what if it doesn't pass?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And I cannot afford therapy.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think you really need to take it one day at a time. Things are very raw for you right now
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: There are some organisations that will offer a certain number of sessions for free
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't know if I could do that. I don't like talking about my problems with strangers.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And yet here we are :P. Therapy can be surprisingly beneficial, I have found.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do realise that it can be hard to open up to how we are feeling though. I know that I was
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you have any suggestions about how to open up to people I don't know?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that is useful to remember that we are all human and that most people have been hurt in this way at some point. No-one will be judging you
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's what I am afraid of. Being judged by people.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think that this might partly because your ex has eroded your self esteem?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Probably. He called me a lot of names.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: The important thing is to gradually rebuild your self esteem. Do you have any things that you excel at?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm good at bowling. And I like riding horses.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Animals are a wonderful source of comfort when we are feeling very low! Could you join a riding club to make some new friends?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Maybe I will do that. Horses are so cool.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can feel that you are starting to make progress already and are thinking of things that you can do post break up
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I sure am. Thanks for your help.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are most welcome. Is there anything else you would like to talk to me about?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't think so...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, I wish you all the very best for the future. I know that things seem terrible right now but please believe me they will get better
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks! Have a good day.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And you have a lovely day too. I know that you are going to be just fine in a few weeks from now. Stay strong!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I am so mad that my boyfriend broke up with me because I cheated on him once. He has cheated on me many times and I never broke up with him.

dialog.text: I am so mad that I can't see straight.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello! What is on your mind today?

dialog.text: Oh really? Why is that?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well, my boyfriend has cheated so many times that I cant count them. I then meet someone nice and cheat on him once and now he breaks up with me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: being mad that your boyfriend cheated is normal. being mad when dumped is normal.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: don't you think you DESERVE better than he was treating you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you! I can see that I am talking to someone who understands.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am wondering if I should beg him back?? I really do love him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I've been there too
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Expecially with covid, it can be hard realiing you may be alone and it may be frusterating dating someone new
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: if you really love someone, shouldnt they love you back? did his actions show love?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, and we have been together since high school so it is really hard to think of ever marrying anyone else. He asked me to marry him but we never made it official or got rings.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: if you did get back together and get married, how do you know he wouldnt cheat again? what if you had kids? they would have to see you go through heartbreak
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i think its normal to want to marry your high school sweetheart
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He told me he never wants kids with me but acts like he would have them someday, somehow? I think you're right.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: i married mine. 3 years later he left me to move into his girlfriends house leaving me with our two month old daughter
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: trust me, its not worth it in the long run
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: maybe you can find someone deserving on someone like you!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Noway! That is my worst nightmare, I am so sorry. That is a real eye opener for me/ That is exactly what I don't think I could handle. I just am in the worst cycle ever and don't have any friends to turn to or anybody who wants to listen to the drama.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think I have wasted a lot of my life and I can't ever get the time back that I have invested in him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: i think a lot of couples are feeling stuck with covid. once things open up and everyone is vaccinated and get togethers happen again, i bet there will be a LOT more breakups and a lot more options out there!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: all we can do is learn from our mistakes and not let the past repeat itself
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, I can see your point. It is nice being able to vent to you and feel like I am being heard. I never got that in my relationship with him. I need to learn from the past this time and stop repeating it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: with your newly aquired free time, you can focus on you! start a new hobby, dye your hair,do something you always wanted to do!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I haven't even had the time to get myself cute and fixed up in forever! I love that idea! I need to get my haircut.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: know what the best part is?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, I have idea?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: get yourself fixed up and cute, and find a hot new guy. your ex will see on social media and know he messed up and see you happy. its quite theraputic :D
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: HAHA!! YES!! I was thinking the exact same thing! The best revenge is moving on and looking good and with somebody hot!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: EXACTLY! You deserve so much better! Make yourself feel like it and everyone see it! :D :D
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sounds great! I am revived and am going to schedule a spa day and reinvent myself! Out with the old! Thank you for your encouragement today. I am going to move on from this mess and make my life better. Thanks again!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Good luck!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: The partiality in my work place and the favorability to people who hardly work but always say "yes" to my manager's say.

dialog.text: Hi
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Im feeling down and need some advice as to how do I handle this situation
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: hello how are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm doing ok
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: How about you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm doing well. Ok I can help. Whats going on?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's to do with some of my peers who hardly work but are favorable to my Manager as they always say yes to his word.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It sounds like you are unsure of how to deal with favoritism in the workplace. I have dealt with similar situations.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, it bothers me as I cannot tolerate injustice
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: When did this start?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: for about a year
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Can you tell me some examples about the injustice?
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I don't have enough money to buy my kids christmas gifts.

dialog.text: Hello there
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hi
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: How are things going?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not good. I'm depressed.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there anything in particular that has been bothering you recently?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't have enough money to buy my 5 kids X-mas gifts.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are you still here?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, but I'm sure your love for your kids can still shine through
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do love my kids, but they are expecting some toys and stuff from Santa.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Would it be possible to look at some more home made stuff for this year that will still be fun and meaningful?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I cannot craft. If I made them something it would be so bad.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I know it can be really hard to feel like you can't make anything worthwhile, but I'm sure theres something you could come up with that could still put a smile on your kids faces
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you have any craft ideas?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Maybe you could look at involving your kids in the process. The feeling of doing something together as a family can make it way more fun. It could be a shared experience your family can look back on fondly later on.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's a good idea. I would like to have it done before christmas. How about some wooden toys or a cardboard box fort?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have seen some people make small ornaments filled with candies and treats and other small goodies. So even if all of the gifts feel small, they can feel like they are getting a lot of them. And you could even get them to have fun decorating and painting the ornaments!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, a box fort is really fun!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I never that about filling an ornament with small stuff. That's a great idea.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: When I was a kid, I loved making box forts, and its a great way to reuse stuff you might already have around the house. The fun pretend games you can play were a blast. I'm sure your kids might love it too!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I could paint and decorate it. My daughters would like that. I can make it look like a castle.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It can feel tough when it feels like you can't provide all the big gifts that you feel your kids deserve
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: But you clearly care and love your kids, and want to do something for them
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do. this has been very helpful. It's not all hopeless.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Last Christmas when I gave gifts to my family, one of them later told me that the gift they loved the most was the box of Christmas cookies that they were able to enjoy over the course of the week afterwards, and not the keyboard I had gotten them. Sometimes it doesn't take something expensive to be meaningful and make someone happy
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That sounds wonderful. I'm getting to work on my projects. Thank you.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm really glad to hear that. It still might feel tough, but truly things are not hopeless
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I failed my Finals and now I am on academic probation. I am afraid I will be expelled.

dialog.text: Hello.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello! How are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm not doing very well unfortunately.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I failed my college finals, and now I'm up for Academic Probation.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am so sorry to hear that, I'd love to understand more about what you are struggling with?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm almost near gradution too.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh no! I am so sorry to hear that. Academic probation does seem very scary. When did you learn you failed your finals?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I learned yesterday. Because of the pandemic the semester is shorter.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And how long do you have until graduation?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I should be graduating in June.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I see. Well it's nice that we matched up! I actually work at a college and now a couple good strategies to get off academic probation, and or avoid it! What is it you are studying?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You're a great resource then! I am majoring in Psychology with a minor in Biology.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh that is awesome! So when do you find out whether or not you are on probation?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Likely in the next week.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I registered for my classes for next semester but I think I should drop my minor. \
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can't overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I also recommend making an educational plan. Although it can seem scary and long to see your goals directly laid out in front of you, it really helps with motivation
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's great advice and likely would be my best option.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I will definitely do that. I feel better hearing that it's okay to drop my minor. I felt like a failure when I considered it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: From talking with you so far, I can tell that you are stressed about this. But I want to reassure you that your mental health should always come first. It is the most important thing you can do.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes I am very stressed. I hate taking online courses and this pandemic is wearing me out.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Plus I have a 2 year old son.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are definitely not a failure in the slightest! In fact, I would argue that you are the exact opposite of that. Being able to take such difficult courses in a pandemic, and raise a child shows how strong you are!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for saying that. It is tough, but I just want to finally finish my Bachelor's and do something positive.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And you will succeed in that goal. You have the motivation and the care for it, you just need to focus on managing everything at once!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you thought about meeting with an academic advisor and laying out a plan?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes. I had plans to. I am going to go an make an appointment immediately.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I appreciate your time, encouragement, and support.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I decided to go back to school to complete my Master's degree, but I feel really overwhelmed between being a parent, having a career, and going to school at the same time.

dialog.text: Hello, I have been feeling very overwhelmed with school.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello. I totally understand being stressed out by school. I am currently in a Ph.D. program and it can be overwhelming. Do you have any hobbies to help with your stress?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do like to read, but I haven't had enough time. I have been going on walks more frequently.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It sounds like you do a lot of activities that are solitary. Have you considered maybe partaking in a similar activity, like a book club, where there is more interaction with people?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, I did not consider that actually. I do enjoy my alone time since I am so busy and I have a toddler, but maybe doing something more sociable would be good.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being busy, especially with having a small child can make you feel lonely, enhancing the stress you feel from school. Participating in social events geared toward your interest might be able to connect you to people with similar feelings!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think so too. I never thought of it like that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sure that you are trying your best to be both a good student and a great parent. It is understandable that you may not have considered those options.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes I constantly think of my son and family, and I didn't think involving myself in sociable activities would be beneficial.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I figured I really needed some alone time. I didn't realize I could be experiencing loneliness.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It is so admirable that you are acting so selfless.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Are you aware of any activities that you can participate in that can include your family? It could be the best of both worlds.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, we like to go swimming at the YMCA together.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is great! Physical activity has been shown to reduce stress levels.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My sister-in-law really benefits from having her sons in sports. She is able to connect with the other team moms and considers them some of her best friends. Depending on your YMCA your son may be able to participate in some of their programs?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, and swimming is great exercise.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And if we do that more we can spend more time together.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have been looking into putting him in soccer.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: He can start at 3 years old.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Soccer would be a perfect way for both you and your son to interact with other people of similar interests.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think so too. You gave me a lot to think about today that I didn't consider before.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am glad to help, Hopefully, considering these options will not only reduce your stress from being busy with being a parent and with school, but it will also bring you closer to your child.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, and both of those are major goals of mine. But the stress sometimes feels inevitable.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sometimes stress is inevitable. You just have to know how to channel it. Some use physical activity, others use journaling. These seem to be outlets you can consider?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: The physical activity for sure.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I do so much writing with my Master's program. Sometimes I feel like my hand will fall off.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Physical activity seems to be the option you are most interested in.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you considered setting daily exercise goals?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I am a pretty active and fit person.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes, I do try to go to the gym 3 times per week at least.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Having goals for a given day can help motivate you to do the exercises and keep your head cleared from stress.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree. I will definitely start to engage in more activities with peers and more swimming with my family. Thank you for your advice!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Your welcome.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: My friend totally screwed me over. We were doing a business deal and he lied about how much money we got from the deal. He screwed me!

dialog.text: Hi, how are you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm doing well. How are things going with you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm really pissed off. My friend totally screwed me over. We were doing a business deal and he lied about how much money we got from the deal. He screwed me!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh no, that must be so frustrating for you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We made a piece of software together. It was sweet. We were marketing it to different firms. We thought we could make a bundle.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you were partners in the development of the software and both put in a lot of work? Did you have any indication that he might try to defraud you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: The stupid SOB went behind  my back and cut a deal. I didn't get as much as I should have. I totally didn't suspect anything because we had been friends for so long.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I guess the money was too sweet. Never again...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So it feels like he took advantage of your friendship. That must be hard, but don't beat yourself up about it.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Let's come up with some safeguards for the future to avoid more incidents.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Good point. I feel like a fool, but it could happen to anyone.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Safeguards. Ok.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What do you think you might have done differently? You can only control your behavior, not the other guy's. Could you have put a contract in place?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Or have a shared Google drive where you both put all the information relevant to the development and marketing?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You doing okay?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It was nice talking with you, and I do hope I helped you feel more in control of your next business venture. It's okay to feel that anger at your (former) friend, too. Use that feeling to work through things and I'm sure you'll be feeling more optimistic soon.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Ex girlfriend issues.

dialog.text: Hi! How is life treating you right now?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: ITs been better. I am dealing with issues in life.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What sort of issues are you having? I am happy to listen
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: she was giving her kids who were 12 and 15 drugs, I turned her in to CPS for it. The relationship ended in a fury and  a mess.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Who is she? A partner, a sister or similar? I am glad you turned her in, whoever she was.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: girlfriend.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: well ex girlfriend.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a really lousy thing for her to have done. I am glad that you did the right thing!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Shes pretty furious from what I know. Shes trying to stalk me and find where I moved to. I left the state i lived in over all this. shes been known to be a bit violent and crazy in her reactions.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you considered getting a restraining order against her? That should be quite easy to do
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: it would then give her my address to where I live, which is what I fear most. as she then knows right where I am. the whole reason i left was to have her not know my location.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hope that she would not be informed as to where you live though yes, I understand the dilemma. Have you spoken with the police?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have. I looked into it. and if i file a restraining order, it will give her my address. To supress my address it would take charges filed and things of the sort. Shes crafty.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Wow that sounds like it has put you in a bind. I do understand cos once I had to flee from a boyfriend and was scared he would come after me.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: She will definately come after me. I have evidence that makes her guilty that has been turned into the attorneys and cps. Shes losing custody of her daughter who is 12. The 15yr old lives with the father. so she wont lose custody, but im sure her visits will be messed up.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Are you still in contact with her kids? Do you have a good relationship with them?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am not. I am not planning on it either. Staying away is the best plan.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It might help them a lot to have someone stable in their life though?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: they have fathers. I am not involved like that. we had a short relationship and I am sure her girls will be bitter with me even tho i did the correct thing by turning her in.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: but the guilt from turning her in is terrible.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You did the right thing. Would you have wanted the girls to end up as addicts, dead or in prison?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: She was not a good person. So it makes it easy to not regret it. but i still feel guilty. guilt caused issues last month when this all started and came to a head. it was a mess. I was a mess. things happened.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think that perhaps the guilt is not entirely related to your circumstances currently?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I dont believe so. The guilt to me sets with causing a disruption between mother and daughters. It created a large burden for me to bear.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I know it is difficult but I hope that you can manage to move on from this and find happiness.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for talking and I wish you all the best.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Well we are at different places in our lives. My partner wants to leave to go to another state to be with her cousin. I want to stay around the family we have here already.

dialog.text: Hello, how are you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm doing ok
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's good to hear. Is there anything that you would like to talk about?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, me and my partner are considering breaking up as she wants to move to another state to be with her cousin and have a fresh start. I want to stay and be around my family. So that is the dilemma.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So it sounds to me like you're experiencing stress about choosing between staying in your current relationship, or staying close to your family. Do I have that right?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes and its very hard for me to make a decision on which to choose.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can understand how that feels. Anybody would have a hard time deciding between those options.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: May I ask you a question about your relationship?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, sure
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Compared to other relationships that you've had in the past, how strongly do you feel about this one?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I would say compared to every relationship I have had, this is the best relationship I have been in. Plus we have children involved.

dialog.speaker: usr

I'm not sure on the work you do, but you putting your health at risk everyday to make a living for you and your family makes you an amazing person. Just try and remember that your health is very much more important then your job and just make sure you are trying everything possible to keep yourself safe out there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks for the positive vibes, but I doubt things will get better.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course! I also am afraid that this pandemic is going to get worse before it gets any better and that is just my opinion. I am scared for everyone out here anymore and its not just people getting sick and ill, but people like you who could be in jeopardy of loosing their job or their source of income. That's is something that would be on anyones mind, more yours then mine due to you actually working in the public.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: There is a lock down in my area, I fear it will only get worse.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: We thankfully have not got on lockdown just yet, but I know it will be happening soon. We live in a very small town and it has got bad here that either we know someone who has it, or someone in the family has it. It seemed like it just happened over night that it just spread so fast here that everyone is in a panic mode again. What type of things do you do while you are on lockdown?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Think about the bad things that will happen if I lost my job. I have been only thinking about the bad..
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can only imagine. Is it yourself in your home? What I have tried to do is stay away from the news that has anything to do with covid that could maybe help a little. And god forbid anything happens to you and you do loose your job just know there are a lot of resources around that would help you in any struggles that you fear or end up facing. I know its hard and stressful to search and look for things like that but trust me it will take a lot of stress off your mind.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am not religious, but thanks for the uplifting words. I just don't see a bright side over the fence.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry about that I didn't realize I put that, sometimes it just comes out but I do apologize. I know it's hard to think that this will not come to and end, but just try and think there is always a light at the end of the tunnel, and I'm hoping for you and what your doing and putting in, something will come out positive in your favor, even if its just a small step forward. Hey its all gotta start out somewhere.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No worries. Any activity suggestions to keep my mind off of COVID-19?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you have children or a spouse that lives with you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, this is why, if I lose my job, my financial situation will affect the family.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have children as well, and what I have tried to do is like a at home drive in movie night, or simple board games. I don't have a spouse but I would think maybe an inside dinner night or even a lunch date. Have the kids even help out with that. You'll be amazed on how excited they would be even if it's the little things they can help with like the seating or drawing of the menus. And for maybe the inside drive in make up little movie tickets, and candy and popcorn like a little concession stand.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks for the suggestions. This pandemic has really taken a toll on me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I completely understand. I know its hard not to think about it because it is EVERYWHERE, but if your spouse or children see or sense the stress its causing you they can also feel it, and can start stressing over it too. Even trying these things will cause a smile and a fun time for those moments that will make every one happy and not think about covid, because they will all be thinking about how much fun they are having with you and the family, and that will help with the stress even if its just a little bit.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh I understand how that can be.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Would you like to tell me about it?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Ok. I have a friend who I've known a long time, who is one of my closest friends, but who is extremely insecure. She constantly seeks affirmation that I love and care for her, even though she should KNOW I do, since we have been friends for so long.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can understand how that can become a source of frustration after a while.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Would you like to share what pushed it beyond the normal point today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's just been an ongoing thing that has escalated recently because she's so afraid and timid and doesn't believe anyone could really love or care for her. I get sick of having to say that of course I love her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can relate because I also have a close friend that seeks constant reaffirmations.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you spoken with her about this?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have. I address it every time it comes up. She always sells herself short. Recently I suggested she could babysit my kids, she agreed, then almost immediately said it was ok if I had someone better in mind, and didn't want her, even though I had asked her!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: do you talk to your friend about it?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sometimes it is very difficult to see yourself through someone elses eyes when you undervalue yourself.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know it may be difficult to remain patient when your friend repeatedly does this, but maybe you could explain to her that it makes you feel like she is mistrustful of your opinion when she second guesses your taste in friends.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I know. Until she finds her self worth, it doesn't matter what any of her friends say to her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have actually told her that. That it seems like she doesn't trust me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Possibly explaining it in a way she can relate to would be helpful.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I did in fact speak with my friend and it helped our relationship quite a bit. We continue to be very close 20 years later.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's frustrating to me and gives me anxiety because I wish I could change her to see herself the way I, and others, do. But I know I can't make her see her self worth. That's something she has to find for herself.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's good to hear about you and your friend.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can feel your frustration just by our conversation, and I too wish that she could see that you value both her and your friendship enough to reach out to someone that can just listen. Don't forget that your feelings are valid as well.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know they are. And yes, she's dealing with a lot, but we all are, and it would be so much better for her if she could trust the people who love her to actually love her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sometimes you have to take a step back and fill your own cup.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Indeed. Thank you for your input.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think a break would help you feel better able to deal with the demands of her friendship?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It has been my pleasure! I trust you will make the right choice! Best of wishes!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not really, because I'd just worry about her. She needs someone like me to look after her. I'm kind of the Yin to her Yang. Thank you for your time and conversation!
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: Not being able to do my daily routine is really getting to me. It's hard to get up every morning.

dialog.text: Hello, how are you doing?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm doing okay.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there anything you want to talk about?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm having problems with getting up everyday and doing my daily routine. I feel bad because these are things that other people do normally
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah, I've definitely felt that way...especially during COVID and having to adjust to working from home. What are some of the things in your routine during the day?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Exactly. Jogging, eating breakfast, getting dressed
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yep, for me it's kind of felt like working remotely and all the crazy 2020 stuff was kind of an excuse to just "take a break" from grinding. MTurk has kind of helped me get back in a working mindset and given me more energy...have you been doing a lot of MTurk lately?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, 2020 has been a crazy year. I've been doing Mturk here and there. I plan on doing it more. It helps me stay productive.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah it helps, just forcing yourself to have goals, for sure. I've been determined to hit a number on MTurk and exercise every time I'm feeling tired, instead of taking a nap because my boss can't see me, lol. I would definitely say just start setting goals and try to look forward to 2021 being better.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Okay, I hear you. Thanks. Yeah, I guess I have to really force myself.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Force yourself at first, then the "body in motion, stays in motion" law will take over. :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: All I know, is that nothing is worse than ending a day without a sense of accomplishment and then stringing those kinds of days together.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Okay okay. cool. That's a helpful concept. I'm going to force myself to get up and then hopefully my body will get used to it. Yes, that's true. I hate ending the day knowing I've bummed it out
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: One of the things I've noticed about 2020 and I think this contributes is that this year has taken away almost all incentives...you know before it would be like, "I'm looking forward to this concert, or this movie coming out next weekend." So, when you aren't planning things and don't have these milestones throughout the year of events breaking up the monotony, it stinks.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I agree. I used to go to at least one concert every year. Now that's out of the question. It gets boring and a little depressing. Hopefully 2021 will be better.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sure it will be. Definitely try tomorrow morning to get up and exercise and maybe hit the MTurk hard, also hobbies definitely help and being at home is a great time to learn new skills.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I will definitely. I just got to get up and get with it. I'm really in need of some exercise so I'll do that too. I used to paint and draw but I kind of fell off and stopped doing it. I'll get back into that too.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh yeah, nothing is worse than losing joy in something you love doing. But, getting back in an active mindset helps. I used to love to have bonfires, it really was therapeutic for me but then I just lost the will to have them. Since I've been back on MTurk and trying to be more active these last couple weeks, I had one on Saturday and really enjoyed it. So much of the passion lost for hobbies isn't because we grow out of them, it's quite frankly because we are probably just depressed.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree fully and I'm happy for you. I think I've been in some sort of depression for some time now. I stopped doing everything I loved. I used to love jogging but I stopped doing that too. I ended up gaining a lot of weight and now I don't like going anywhere or being seen at all. I'm usually 130 and I've shot up to 200. So I think if I can just get my routine down and exercise, I'll be alright.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yep for sure, just get back at it and learn to love it again. Anyways, good talking to you!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You too and thanks for the support!
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: 7 weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop having an affair.

dialog.text: Hi, I am having a tough time processing a correct decision today
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Good morning. What type of decision is troubling you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: A few weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop our affair. It is the right choice for him because he feels he should work on his marriage. I admire that, yet It is very lonely for me right now
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can understand the feeling lonely would make you feel your decision was wrong but from an outsiders view, it was not a healthy relationship if he was already committed to someone.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You deserve something better. Someone dedicated to you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It was a fantastic experience. we were together for 3 years. I am not mad at him, he's a good guy. He was separated when we met. But as all life, it's complicated
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I completely understand. I have been in your shoes before. I learned a lot and found out more about myself in the growing experience after the relationship ended. I'm sure there was some positives even with you at the end of the relationship now.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Each person is put in our life for a reason or season. This may just be the stepping stone to finding your soul mate. The perfect relationship won't feel so tricky in the long run and will make you feel on top of the world!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I had my eyes wide open during the process and he and I were very open with our communication. I can see lots of blessings but I am just so sad. Each day is a challenge to focus
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can't imagine a relationship right now
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sounds like you really but your heart in to this and I'm sure it hurts. No need to rush relationship. Falling back in love with yourself is the key first. Finding your inner happiness will make the next relationship that much better and stronger!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Treat yourself to a few solo dates to find joy in the day to day life you are now building without him.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have heard the idea of dating ones self
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I haven't been out to eat for over a year due to the pandemic situation
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It can be fun! No decisons on who wants to go where. It is all about you enjoying the moment and your own company!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No need to go out if you feel uncomfortable. Find a movie you have been wanting to watch and order some take out! Or do some online shopping while enjoying your favorite dessert or adult beverage!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: During this time with the affair, I had the strength to leave a narcissistic spouse that abused me emotionally. I am proud of myself for that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is a lot to handle! I am proud of you for that as well! No one ever deserves to be abused. Some solo time to rebuild your independance may do you wonders and give you back your strength and self confidence! Seems like the past year has been emotionally draining.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It has been. You are right about me focusing on solo time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think you know yourself better than anyone else and are about to leap in to a new chapter of your life. You received lessons from both the past relationships and can take that forward knowing what you wish for and deserve.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for letting me talk about this. It is a touchy topic, affairs. My heart was so loved during that time but I always told him that if he needed me to step back, I would. It has been difficult on both of us.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Being a parent, having the families meshed together, homes, work, etc.... I can understand why he feels he should try again.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sometimes talking about why you are feeling is the best way to find closure. Keep the memories of the love and good times but know that in the end you were destined for something so much more. As adults we try so often to find happiness in others. He is a good person for wanting to try to resolve the situation for his family but that does not mean he did not love you or that your relationship was not a bright spot in his life as it was yours. I'm sure he is hurting too.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thank you so much for saying that. It really means a lot to me and grounds me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: you are correct, that I need to move forward for me. I deserve it. That's a concept I have been learning.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You deserve peace through this transition. It will take some time but I think you will come out even stronger and happier on the long run. Journaling may be a great outlet for your emotions as well.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thank you for that idea. He was my muse in that relationship and I would write beautiful stories and poetry for him. Writing out my journey to the next stage of my life would be beneficial
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think so! It may also let you heal while building your creativity even more! You seem like a very passionate and loving person.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You made me heart smile... thank you.. !! I am glad that I got to speak with you today!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are so very welcome! You were a pleasure to talk to and I wish you all the best! Let this year be YOUR year!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course! With time you will get the hang of it. Well thats good to hear! Maybe you could ask one of them to coffee and express how you are feeling. I would bet that they felt the same when they started.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think what I do is so complicated I sometimes wonder if I've been off more than I can chew. is this something you can relate to?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That certainly is something I can relate. There was a period of time in school where i signed up for way too many classes and had to drop out of a few. If you feel like you are in over your head it is ok to take a step back. It is important that you take care of your self and know your limits. :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I suppose it's difficult to know when something is too much for you or if you need to give it more time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would say if you are showing signs for several weeks of being overwhelmed (tired, stressed, snappy etc.) That is probably is too much
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thankshe problem is I've worked really hard to get a better position and if I wasn't successful and feel like a failure. maybe I should look at it like this job just isn't for me if, like you say, I can't seem to get on after several weeks.

dialog.text: I would say thats the right option if this persists. I am sure there are other jobs that would fit you well!

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: They told she's bad news
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand it can be very difficult at times with parents. Especially since they lived in a life that was very different from today.

dialog.text: Have you tried talking to you parents about why she is "bad news"?
