situation: I think I need to break up with my girlfriend because my feelings have changed

dialog.text: Hi there how can I help you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have been in a relationship for just over two years. At the start it was fun and we got along great. I think we have little in common these days and I don't feel the same way I used to. I don;t want to hurt her feelings but I'm thinking about ending the relationship.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you been feeling this way for a while or is it a surprise change?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have felt like this for a while now but I'm thinking about if more nowadays. It doesn't feel right and I don't know who to handle it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you have felt for a while that things aren't right in your relationship and you don't know how to end the relationship without hurting your girlfriend's feelings?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's correct yes. I worry that she will be very upset and the thought of her in distress does concern me. It might be easier to stay together but I don't think that's the right thing to do.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can tell that you are a nice person that cares for your girlfriend and you want the best for her. I think you want to be honest with her which is a good sign of maturity and integrity.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks for that. I do care for her which is why I don't want to upset her.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Unfortunately this may be upsetting in the short term. I had a friend who had a similar issue. He wanted to end things with his girlfriend and they ended up having an honest conversation, which was upsetting at the time but they are still friends to this day and parted on good terms.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It is good that it is possible to do this and still become friends afterwards. I do worry about how this would go and am fearful that she will react badly. How would you go about it?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think the best thing to do would just be honest about your feelings and start the conversation with her. I think you could also consider when is the right time to do this so that you minimise the affect that this may have on her.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm not sure what you mean by the right time. Is there ever a right time to do this?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: People who have a negative experience at a key point in their lives, such as a birthday of Christmas, tend to remember that bad experience the following year. I mean choose an appropriate time to have the discussion.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Ok I get it. Don't dump her on her birthday LOL. So I should just start the talk then, may be one evening?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes when she is available to have a good talk about this. Do you have my friends that you can talk to about this?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I do have some friends that know how I am feeling yes. Maybe they can help me come up with a plan off what to say.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it's best to be honest and if it comes from the heart then you can at least say you have been honest with yourself and your girlfriend.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think this is going to be hard but thanks for the suggestions
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think you can do this and have confidence that you will do it in the right way. These things are not easy but I know you can ride to the challenge and do this tactfully and with care.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks for the kind words. I'll give this a try.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are very welcome.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Ok bye
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Take care
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I have dealt with depression around this time of the year since i was 17.  I am now 37.  My cousin got killed in a car accident on Dec 29th  at the age of 14.  Then 18 years later on Jan 3rd I lost my boyfriend in a car accident.  I struggle around the holidays even worse now than I  did before.

dialog.text: Hi there, how are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am doing ok.  How are you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm doing well, thanks for asking. What are you seeking support for today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have been struggling for motivation to do anything the past couple weeks.  This is a really hard time of year for me.  I lost my cousin in a car accident at the age of 14 in a car accident coming up on 20 years this year.  We were very close.  I was 17 at the time.  Her was an alcoholic and my parents raised her a majority of her life.  Then 3 years ago 5 days after her death anniversary I lost my boyfriend at the age of 32 in a car accident.  I dread the holidays.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you for sharing that. It sounds like you are describing a strong association between the holiday season and loss of loved ones. This leads to less of a desire to engage in typical holiday events. Does that sound right?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You are exactly right.  The year my cousin got killed her mom was hungover so I went and picked up my cousin and her little brother to take them to our grandparents house for Christmas dinner.  She died 4 days later on Dec 29th.  And my boyfriend it was his first day back to work after the New Year.  He died on Jan 3rd.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I usually go all out for the holidays to try to hide my depression every year.  This year I just can't bring myself to enjoy them.  I have even bought one christmas present.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can see why this time of year is difficult for you. Trying to hide depression can be a challenge. Rather than hiding the sadness or grieving feelings, some people find relief in acknowledging and sharing these feelings with family members who may relate. Do you ever share these feelings with your cousin or grandparents that you mentioned?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My cousin doesn't live around here and we have never been real close.  He is alot younger than me.  We just never had the connection like his sister and I did.  And both my grandparents have passed away.  Grandpa has been gone for 12 years and Grandma has been gone for 4 now.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: My family has always been really good about talking about our loses. Things just will never be the same.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand. When losses are experienced it is a great change in many aspects of our lives.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Are there any aspects of the holidays that bring you joy? Maybe holiday music, movies, bright snow (if there is snow where you live), or seeing joy on someone's face when you give them a great gift?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: They say it gets easier. And I agree it does.  Things just have changed so much.  I miss how life was before I lost them.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I understand - and it is normal to feel that way. When we lose someone who brought us happiness, it is only natural to miss them and their company.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I love giving gifts.  And I always put lots of thought into the gifts I give.  My nieces and nephews can't wait every year to see what I got them.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's great! You must have a special talent for personalizing your gift selections. Perhaps focus on that reaction from you nieces and nephews to support your motivation for giving gifts this year.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: This year I am tie dying hooded sweatshirts.  I make tshirts for a hobby.  And to tell you the truth thats the only gifts I have gotten so far.  My oldest daughter turned 18 this year and lives with her boyfriend so its just me and my 15 year old daughter.  She struggles with depression/anxiety as well.  Her dad has been in jail for some stupid actions since August.  She has had to deal with him being an addict pretty much her whole life.  I think we are both missing how the holidays were with her sister still living at home.  Too much change in our lives in such a little time frame.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Wow, what a great gift idea! That is a solid start on your gifts for the season, and something to be proud of.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: They will love them.  A couple years ago I put their names on fleece blankets when I worked at an embroidery shop.  They absolutly loved them!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And I see, it sounds like the changes in your life are potentially impacting your daughter as well. However, I'm glad you have each other for support this season. This year has been crazy for many reasons, and many people tend to find comfort in routines or traditions. Do you and your daughters have any holiday traditions you typically complete?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Awesome gift idea! Personalized gifts are always so heartfelt and appreciated. Good thinking!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Just the normal traditions.  My oldest daughter will be here for Christmas morming.  Then we go to my parents.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you for chatting with me tonight!  I hope you have a good rest of your night.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: My new supervisor hates me.  She already hated me before she was my boss. In addition to being a terrible manager, she has made a personal goal to inhibit my ability to do my job.  She has taken from me all parts of my job that I value.  This upsets me personally and I am sad & angry that the rest of my team, who I care about, is no longer supported.  We have no recourse to solve this problem.

dialog.text: Hello there, how is life treating you at the moment?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not too bad outside of work.  I'm miserable there.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you are experiencing problems at work? Please tell me about it, I am happy to listen.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Things have changed and my new supervisor has crushed my spirit by taking all the parts I love away.  She never liked me and now she gets to make me suffer.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am very sorry to hear that - trouble with workmates, especially those who are in a higher position, can make things very miserable can't they?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: They really can.  I used to love my job and my team.  Now she has made everyone miserable because she just doesn't care about learning the job or the job at all.  My morale is low and worse because I can't help my peers who are struggling as well.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you considered going over her head and putting in a complaint? Especially if she is making everyone else miserable as well. Someone more senior might be able to do something.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have considered this many times.  Unfortunately, the next level manager doesn't respect or value my team in general.  She has made that clear.  She's also just awful and uncomfortable to talk to.  I've found her to just be mean sometimes.  It just feels so hopeless.  Just waiting for someone to notice.  Just hoping she fails.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It's just really hard to show up everyday.  But I do.  Although the days are long and exhausting with no motivation to perform.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Please try to stay positive - bullies never prosper in the long term. I think that you need to talk to your co-workers about this and see if you can come to some sort of arrangement between you
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Alternatively, have you ever considered seeking another job? I know that that might feel like selling out but you might be happier somewhere else
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You are right.  She is a bully.  I have called her several names to myself, but not a bully yet.  My coworkers and I have discussed what options we may have.  My suggestion was that we work at our normal pace rather than scrambling to make up for her failures.  I wouldn't want to set her up, but I think her failing is the only way we will ever see a solution.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have applied for another job within my company.  There seems to be interest in me, so that's exciting.  It is a job I really want.  But then, of course, I feel bad about leaving my peers behind.  I really care about them.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I feel that that is fair enough. You should not be working to make up for her failures and I hear you saying that you feel that this is w hat is happening?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Definitely. Everyone is struggling.  I am the one my team expects to help with some of the tasks she is not performing.  I'm happy to do it for my team, but there is no recognition.  But I think I have been giving them good advice about hanging in there, staying positive, etc...  I should probably listen to myself.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: (sorry was afk give me a second to catch up :))
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I really feel that you have grounds for a formal complaint. Just her being incapable is bad enough but bullying too is unacceptable
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You may be right.  My company has an anonymous reporting system.  I should learn a little more about how that works and see if that's an option.  I'm not sure things could get much worse at this point.  This could be my last ditch effort.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's good advice and you saying it directly to me makes me think I should lean into it.  I can't just spin my wheels in misery much longer.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Anonymous reporting sounds like a good thing, as long as it's not being abused. This sounds like a very good time to use it though
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I hope I have been able to give you some good advice here!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Most definitely. I feel more confident now about the anonymous reporting.  I'll gather some notes from my peers to ensure I have a viable complaint.  That's so helpful.  Thank you.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are most welcome, enjoy your day!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Not having enough friends nearby.  My three nearby friends went away for holidays, so I have no one to spend time with over this weekend.

dialog.text: Hello how are you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm, okay, thanks, and you?  I'm feeling a bit down because I'm alone for the holidays.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well that's no good, does your family live far away?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, my family is scattered all over the country, like Seattle, Georgia, PA.  I'm sure I'm not the only one with no plans this weekend, though.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: True but I can understand that, it is hard being alone at the holidays.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Did you have plans this weekend?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No.  My nearby friends all went away for the holidays.  I could probably just occupy my time with things I need or want to do in order to distract myself.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What kind of hobbies do you have?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm teaching myself the piano.  I'm also teaching myself  how to work a stenography machine for possible future employment as a stenographer.  I also like to read novels.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have never understood how those work..I find it amazing someone can type out whole words or sentences with one word
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, it's pretty cool.  For example, if I hit DRAT in one stroke, then "Did there come a time" will appear in English on my machine's  LCD screen.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Wow that is crazy, I don't understand how that works, is it preprogrammed or does it go by how the word sounds?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Each stenographer has their own "Personal Dictionary" which is a list of words in English along with how you in particular write out those words or phrases in steno.  This dictionary is present within the actual steno machine after you transfer it from your laptop to the machine via cable or wifi.  Thus your machine then knows how you write out words in particular and how to translate those words from steno to English - each stenographer writes a little differently.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: OK that makes sense, so you basically program it as the user. I take it your stenography machine becomes pretty close to you lol
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Is this your first holiday alone?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, exactly!  And it's very important to back up your personal dictionary to the cloud or a seperate drive so that you don't lose it in a hard-drive crash.  A lot of work goes into creating that dictionary!  No, it's happened before, being along for the holidays; but you've helped to cheer me up, so thanks!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: No problem, I hope I have made your day a little better!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You have, thanks!  Did you do anything special?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have a good rest of this year and don't forget to make your New Year's resolution!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I will do that - you too.  Thanks, again...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Not really, stayed home lol... Have a good one!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You too... bye now...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Good day!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What else can I help you with today?
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I came off of my anti depressants and regret the decision.

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello! How are you tonight?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm okay i guess. But I know my night will get worse as it goes on
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You think your night is going to have emotional upset? Do you fear you will not be physically safe?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know i'll be safe.. but I have depression and it affects me the most at night, every night. I feel like i can't escape it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that. I have struggled to deal with depression most of my life, so I know it can be debilitating, but I have found ways to help myself.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Is there a specific problem making you depressed, or life in general?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'd love to hear them. There is one problem in general i'm having that i seem to have always had because of the Depression. I have an extremely difficult time falling asleep.. and whenever I do manage to fall asleep.. i wake up always feeling like crap. I never feel rested no matter how long i sleep.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have had trouble sleeping in the past and sometimes I still do, usually if it is when I'm nervous about the future.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: The number one way I have had to help my depression is to pray and read scripture. I don't know if you are a Christian, but that has helped me a lot. The second way is to have a good friend who will listen, not someone who will TELL me what to do or judge me, but someone who can empathize with me. A good listener is worth her weight in gold.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've learned that mines not really an emotional thing. I feel like my sleeping issue causes my depression. Because no matter what- i always feel exhausted. Nothing has helped it besides medication. It just sucks always feeling fatigued and energyless. I actually did take up religion here this year to help with the coping that comes with this. It was very helpful for a while there
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: If I didn't get good rest, then I would definitely feel tired the next day and over time, it would wear me out. I believe medication will help with the symptoms, but it is important to get the root of the problem, why exactly you find it difficult to sleep.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sometimes I take a benydryl because they always make me sleepy, but I usually know why I need to relax, I'm nervous about the next day. So I have found it important to know WHY I don't rest well, if that makes sense to you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I plan on seeing a sleep doctor soon! Sometimes I lose sight of fixing the issue and need to be reminded. And yes!! I was treating my sleeping with Benadryl as well but it wasn't healthy to keep doing that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm also thinking there are a few practical ways you can help yourself sleep. I was advised to get soft sheets, make my sleeping area more restful, make sure the time before bed is relaxing and calming.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I also was helped a lot by a Christian Preacher, he's long dead, but he has audio on youtube -- Frank Hammond, Pigs in the Parlor. It's a 5 part series I found helpful, you might want to jot that down.  And I do encourage you to find a counselor, once you rule out the physical (doctor) then you can look at emotional, mental and/or spiritual. I think most of everything is spiritual and emotional to some degree, and our body just responds to that.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I always lose sight of how to make things better. It really helps to talk sometimes so someone can help me put things into perspective. I'll look into Frank Hammond! I am actually religious and would love to look into that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I will definitely pray for you tonight because I know losing sleep is hard to deal with. But please have hope, sometimes we go through these things to possible get to deeper issues that might need to be dealt with. We only have a few minutes here, but I'm pretty old and I have found this to be true so many times.  Get a good support system of good friends. Having people who "get" you is SO vital to our lives. And learning to be grateful helps too. And especially journal, find out what may be bothering you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I had some abuse issues and that is why I had a hard time resting. I also would wake up in the middle of the night and obsess over problems with people. I had a lot to work through, but most nights, I sleep restful now. It may take time.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I have hope for you! :D
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That sounds very similar to my situation! I always had some abuse issues. Thank you so much . Talking to you made me feel a lot better
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Oh, sometimes I would drink Sleepy Time Tea, be kind to yourself. God bless, I'm glad I could encourage you. Sometimes it is really hard to push through difficult times!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'll look into that tea! Thank you so much. God bless
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thanks you too! We are all blessed when we help each other! Have a great night.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You too!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She's high risk, so we have to be careful who we come in contact with. We try to limit time in public and all that. I order groceries for pickup at walmart so i dont have to go in, and my schooling is all online so i dont have to go to class.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She's been fighting cancer. She's in remission now, but her immune system is still compromised and we have to be even more careful than we usually would have to be
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think it's really great that you're doing all that for her! It must be extra hard to have to limit public interactions even more than most people.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That sounds so stressful to have to be worried about her on top of everything else. I'm so sorry you're going through that.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Have you been able to keep in contact with friends through video chat? That's something that can sometimes help when feeling isolated.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, we text and have group chats and stuff, and we snapchat a lot. It's been a while since I saw any of them, though. At least we have that, though.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And yeah, it's really stressful worrying about her. And she feels so bad because I can't see my friends or go in the store or to school
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It sounds like you don't think the online interactions are a good substitute for in-person things. Does that sound right?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Ah, that sounds like kind of a cycle of guilt going on. Where she feels bad about you not being able to go out, and you feel bad about her feeling bad.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, it does. I don't need a lot of in-person interaction. I'm an introvert, so this was all just fine when it started. But even introverts need to be around people sometimes.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah that makes complete sense. It seems like you have a good idea of who you are and what your needs are.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, it does seem like the cycle of guilt.... I try not to let her see how much this is affecting me, but she's my mom and she can tell...
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I wonder if you could do something like take walks in the park with friends, or see them with masks where you're really socially distanced from everyone
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yeah, I'm pretty good at self-analysis lol
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I really hope things get better for you. Covid should be ending soon hopefully with the vaccine, and things will start to go a bit back to normal
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh that's a really good idea! That might be something we can do. It won't be quite the same, but it's better than nothing. I'll ask my mom's doctor if that will be okay.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you. Hopefully it will, and hopefully she will be able to get the vaccine soon, too.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yeah! I hope that works out for you. I've been finding getting outside and doing things with others has been helpful both for social and exercise.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's been really nice chatting with you :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You too!

And even though it's so frustrating, because it's the same problem over and over again, I keep listening because she's my friend. But lately I have been going through a lot, and I haven't had as much time to sit and listen to these same problems, and she gets so angry telling me I don't care about her. The problems I've been going through are very serious, and I just don't have time to sit on the phone listening to the same stuff I've been dealing with for years.

dialog.text: I can understand how angry unappreciated and burnt out you must be feeling.  I would feel that way too

dialog.text: It's been really rough. I've tried so hard to be there for her, and I feel like she just doesn't even appreciate it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I don't think she is a place to be able to see anyone but herself. She is self centereed self asbored and self pity party and doesn't care about anyone but herself right now . Is that accurate?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, that's exactly accurate. And she is 50 years old, and the issues have all been high school type problems that I've been listening to. Stuff about how she didn't post on social media about her birthday, and little petty things like that. Not something an adult should be concerned with. And I still sat and listened to her all that time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I completely understand how unappreciated and stressed this would make you or any person. Especially when our plate is full and its the same old same old and nothing is changing. Its like thinking doing same thing over and over you will get a different result when 2+2 equals 4
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, exactly.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are an extremely good and loyal friend and I am so proud of you. Most people would have left her.

dialog.text: Thank you. That's really important to me. She was starting to convince me that I wasn't a good friend because I wasn't there for her right now when I had problems of my own. Real problems - like my daughter's engagement breaking up.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: However, it is time to take the hard road. YOu are going to have to say with LOVE because its not always what you say but how you say it.  Give me a minute to please type it
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Okay, thank you.

situation: My roommates for next semester do not respect COVID safety or social distancing.

dialog.text: Hello, how are you today?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi. How is life treating you at the moment? Would you like to talk about any problems?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you! And it is good except for one problem. I am in college and my roommates for next semester do not care about COVID -- they continue to go out and party. This upsets me and I have talked to them about it but they still do not care.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you feel that you are being put in danger by the actions of your room-mate?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, absolutely. I do not want to get covid and am worried about long term health effects. I have shared this with them but they still do not care.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can totally understand how you feel.  I absolutely hate how some people are pretending that the pandemic is not real and they do not need to worry.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Also, I am in a triple room in my sorority house for clarification. I feel my risk getting it in the room is high if they continue to not respect guidelines.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do not worry, your fears are totally grounded. Some people really just need to grow up and get educated.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree and appreciate that I am not alone in thinking that!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Many college students have been very irresponsible during the pandemic which is upsetting to me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there anyone at your college who could help you with this? Perhaps move you into a single room?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No, there aren't any sorority rooms available at my sorority house and all of the dorms/apartments are full already but I've tried
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: **single not sorority
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes they certainly have. They seem to think that it will never happen to them and do not realise that they are putting others at risk
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: agreed
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is it possible for you to take some time off school?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I shouldn't do that -- I am applying to law school when I graduate so I feel like it'd be a bad look. it'd also be bad for my mental health to stay home, and I'd rather take the classes I need next semester
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So you feel as though you are trapped .. you can't leave school but at the same time you are being put at risk through no fault of your own
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: right, it's very uncomfortable and no matter how many times I tell them how risky they are being to not only themselves but others they do not care
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: also one of them is pre med which is even worse lmao
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Please be assured that you are being sensible and that they are the ones at fault
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thank u :)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Let's hope that this is over soon .. this has been an absolutely terrible year.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Agreed! Hoping for that vaccine soon
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: what challenges have you faced from the pandemic?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Here in the UK they have started to roll it out.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am so jealous! Things are so much better not in the USA!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I have to agree ;) But we have a large infection and death rate here too, largely due to government irresponsibility
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: haha yes we had the same issue with government mishandling everything ... so frustrating
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you feel it would be better to be somewhere like New Zealand then, where there have been very few cases? It is a lovely country.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: haha yes definitely! I would love to study abroad next year so I hope that will still be an option and COVID will be better then
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So, you feel frustrated both by your roommate and also the conditions in your country?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yes for sure
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can sincerely wish that the world is in a better place next year
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: As do I... although I'm not sure if things will ever go back to the way they were before. But hopefully that is for the best
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Perhaps we can learn something from this year and improve ourselves
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I agree! It's definitely been a year of reflection for sure
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I hope I have been able to be of some help, just by allowing you to talk things out
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yes thank you you definitely have! enjoy the rest of your evening :)
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And you too .. thanks for talking!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: We had a staff appreciation day, but we all got drunk by the end of the day. So now I am worried my boss will judge me or fire me.

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: hi
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: can you talk about your feelings at this time
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Currently I am worried to show up to work. We had a staff appreciation Thursday and we all got super drunk in front of our boss, and I am honestly scared he will judge me or fire me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: that's really hard, have you spoken to any of your coworkers
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, we are all laughing at the matter, but you can tell our boss is looking at us different. We all showed up to work Friday hungover, and he just made lots of comments and jokes to play the part, but you can tell he is looking at me and everyone different. I do not know how to redeem myself.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would recommend speaking with him privately about the issue one on one
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That sounds a lot easier said than done. I was the one who was the most drunk. But I do now know if he knows how drunk we all got since he left after one of us got hit in the face with a golf club and had to take her to the ER. So what if I say too much and apologize for what he does not know.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: have you tried reaching out a company hotline or maybe an hr department in your company to speak about this issue anonymously this could help with the tension between you and your boss
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He is the doctor of the office and the 2 office managers were pretty drunk too. It was a hot mess if I have to be honest and being an office full of girls I feel like we went too far. I for one feel embarrassed, and feel like just not saying anything and it will fade away. But I know the next few weeks will be a little hard, for all of us. This one is for the books, and something I have never encountered in my 10 years of working.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I see how you feel do you think letting it fade is the best option in the long run?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think so. Somethings are sometimes better left unsaid. I just feel like avoiding it, but I do not know if anyone else would do the same. What would you do?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would apologize for my behavior to the manager if it was me. Just to seem professional and get in my bosses good grace.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You have guts. I think I will work on that and build the guts to talk to my boss if I ever have to. Thank you for that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are doing your best and I think you will make the right decision that works for you
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You are right. In the end I will do the right thing, even if it takes me some time to get there.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is anything else bother you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Just that. I think you helped me with the only issue I currently have.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am happy to help!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: you're welcome
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I want more online jobs in this pandemic nut hard to find.

dialog.text: Hi, how are you feeling? Is there anything on your mind?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What would you like to talk to me about today?

dialog.text: yes I would like to find more jobs, hopefuly online

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: haha, i am the same

dialog.text: Mturk really helps as my side job

dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I think that is a great idea. Full mask is better than a partial mask
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Right, thanks for your advice, They do any crazy stuff to make money
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It's a difficult time for us all :) People are doing what they have to in order to put food on their tables I think.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i know right, when in desperation people go crazy
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am hopeful that with the vaccine having been developed, things might start to improve shortly.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: i want to be prepared before I go into that state

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: oh yes the stock price may keep going up. Like Tesla, that cheears me up

dialog.text: Well, maybe the change of administration in some parts of the world will help a little.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: what do you mean?

dialog.text: I mean that political change can help people and give them fresh hope. Or, depress them :)
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh yes
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: They're gonna give out 600 dollars to us I hope
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That would be a big help for people who are struggling!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Right now I am not too desperate and can enjoy listening to Christmas songs,

dialog.text: I am glad to hear that .. too many people think they have to spend too much. Anyway I hope you have had a lovely day and all the best to you

dialog.text: well, thank you for your advice. It was great taoking to you. Merry Christmas

dialog.text: And you!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Have been mostly unemployed since release from prison. This has effected my self impression.

dialog.text: Hi. Currently unemployed and this effects my impression of self as a person, husband and father. Doing mturk work and created a Youtube channel to share information gleaned during prison time.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hi there. I understand how are you feeling. I have been looking for job for the past 5 months and it is a huge challenge.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sorry to hear of you own challenge. Job search sites seem to have so much garbage out there.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you been looking online and try to apply for other jobs?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, have emails coming in from several sites. At the same time though been helping out elderly parents with doctors, cleaning, cooking, etc. How about you?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I know most of them is not helpful and somethimes waste of time. It is important that you keep ypurself busy during this time
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hence doing the mturk work and creating content for the Youtube channel. This is part creative and hopefully income producing in the future.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm doing some kinda gig jobs too. I have been selling a lot things on Ebay, same thing  i can use my creativity and dont let my mind go crazy
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I believe Youtube channel is a great source for new opportunities nowadays
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Everybody is facing a challenge time right now, we are all together on this
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sounds like a similar situation. Not sure if these efforts will pay off long term but need to do something to maintain sanity. Youtube can pay something if there are enough hits and subscribers.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sure, in short term is a good choice. The most impoetant thing is looking foward always. For long term we are going to figure out something else
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Having a religious base too can help.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: For me this is the powerful tool, I pray every single day
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We need to be grateful for beeb alive and for been health.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Unfortunately, too many are at the base of the hill of the Lord and not climbing. Followers, not disciples. Hard to have gratitude when seeing other or thinking of our past.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes but still has few that are on the right path. We need to keep our faith
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Encourage you to continue your journey. This life is but a blip in the eternal spectrum.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sure soon we are going to see the lights at the end of the tunnel.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Unfortunately making amends in some ways depends on having money which requires a job.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What do like to do on your free time?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Working on a notebook of studies I did during my prison time. Content that is becoming the Youtube channel.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Also work out to stay fit and mentally healthy
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sounds interesting. I wish I had more ideas to do youtube as well but  I am not good doing this things.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks for the effort. This task seems to be taking longer than I thought.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Yes Im working out too not much as i wish.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Hard to work out when your bummed
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Going to sign out now.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Everything seens to be great effort I Know
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Okay thank you for your time
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I think that i am gaining weight and hard as i try I can not keep it off and i am getting vry put down.

dialog.text: Hi there.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello. How are you feeling today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am feeling pretty down about my appearance.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I get that way too. Is there any particular cause or aspect you are focussed on?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It is mainly my weight i just can't seem to loose any and it is making me quite sad.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Gosh I am very sorry to hear that you are struggling to loose weight and it is making you sad. May I ask what you are doing to attempt to loose the weight? I hear cardio is very good for that.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well i do use my bike. But i really struggle with motivation and i know i snack too much. But i have just been too busy to spend any real time facing the problem, you know?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I totally understand. I was the same way over worked and under motivated. I found that mixing in low impact weight work outs was really effective as well as each morning setting out healthy snacks that way i don't have to think about getting something it is already there.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh that is a good idea what do you suggest?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Honestly my top favorite are chocolate covered almonds and sugar snap peas. have you tried lowering your carb and increasing your protein intake?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: No i hadn't thought about that don't you have to only drink protein if your work out.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Typically yes but having a low protein shake, ie one scoop not too, everyday is a great way to supplement your caloric intake with protein. You will find yourself less hungry and have more energy through the day.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That actually makes a lot of sense. What about motivation i really need help with that i find when i am less motivated i am definitely more depressed.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Lots of people also struggle with depressive episodes and low motivation. Don't worry you are not alone. It is important to try and think is it depression related low motivation or vice versa.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thats true how can you tell. it is really hard for me right now.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's ok. Don't worry everything will be ok. Remember little steps forward are better and easier to achieve. even if it seems really bad right now just know it will always get better.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thats true.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Just by talking to you I can tell you are down, but you also seem a lot more receptive and motivated that i think you realize. I am sure you can make the changes and succeed.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you so much. Sometimes it just takes someone believing in you
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course everyone needs support now and again and it has been a real pleasure talking to you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks, you too I have a lot to think about. But talking it out really helped. Have a nice day!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Of course good luck stay happy!!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: Long day of work. Came home early, ended up catching my partner having an affair with my roommate

dialog.text: Hello. Is anyone here?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I need a bit of advice
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Sure, what is going on?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: My partner of 4 years... i never thought this would happen but they ended up cheating on me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Caught them in the act
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: With my roommate
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can't believe this. We've been together for 4 years. All of their stuff is in the same house we are living in
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Should I kick them out???
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am truly sorry you had to witness that. Would you feel more comfortable with them leaving or do you think either relationship is salvagable?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's my current problem. I do still love them but... what would happen if I stay and we work on our relationship?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think it would be a good idea to solve the relationship and stay?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: If you feel that something might be salvageable it might be worth looking into. Do you think they'd be open to sitting down and talking it out?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: They did end up crying and saying that it was a mistake. I don't know if it would be a good idea. I think I would have feelings of regret
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: The trust wouldn't be there anymore.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that either way you choose to proceed there is always the choice of remaining amicable. You're all adults, so sitting down and discussing what comes next is an inevitability. Maybe they will choose to leave, or you'll decide it would be better for you to go, but at least the discussion would be ongoing to perhaps resume the friendship at a later time?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'll give it a shot to talk with them. Do you think there would be hateful feelings even if we decided to resume the friendship?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: If you're trying your best to move on and the other party ends up with hateful feelings then I feel like at least you gave it your best right? It might be worth laying low for a little while to sort through the feelings of mistrust and betrayal.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is true. I probably will give it some time to decide on a best course of action. I just needed someone to talk to.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I'm glad I could help
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks again friend!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do your recommend for me to talk right away?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would talk to them as soon as you feel comfortable enough to do so. It might get awkward and leave people to come to other conclusions if it's avoided for too long.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's true. Right now I think it would be too awkward to talk
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is completely understandable. Maybe take a day or two to collect your thoughts. Do you have somewhere to be alone to sift through your feelings?
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I realize my career won't pay much and I feel bad for choosing it

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: hi there! how are you doing?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I feel ashamed thinking of my future career
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Can you tell me a little about what you feel ashamed about?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: whenever we have family gathering, my aunts and uncles would brag about how much their children make. I have higher degree but will only make half of their salary so I feel bad
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So, you feel that your family is judging you for your earning potential?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yes, my parents won't say it to me but they never show they're proud either
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am very sorry for that. They should be proud that you have such a good degree!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What's good if it doesn't translate to my earnings.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I wonder if I should start over with some better degree, but it's expensive
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think you are coming at this from the wrong perspective. Life is not all about money you know!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I want to think otherwise but it's difficult, especially when capitalism is everything nowadays
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think that you enjoy your current field even though it is not as well paid as it could be?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you think that you enjoy your current field even though it is not as well paid as it could be?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I enjoy it, I did some internship and it was nice
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that you should focus on how much you enjoy it. After all you will be working for the next few decades so you do not want to do something that you hate just because it pays well.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Is there anyway for me to change my way of thinking? I keep worrying about all the expense that I'll have to spend and what if I can't afford because of how much I earn
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is it possible for you to talk to your parents about this? It seems to me that they  are at the root of your problems
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't really want to talk to them, I'm not very close to them and rarely tell them my problems
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, if you are not close to them does their opinion really count for so much?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: it still affects me nonetheless
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I do understand how hard it can be to shake off your family's preconceptions and expectations even though you are not close to them
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: thank you for understanding
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are very welcome. Please know that this is a very common problem and a lot of people feel the way that you are feeling now.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: it's tough when I look around and everyone seems to do better than me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you think that you might benefit from some counselling to help you overcome your self esteem issues?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I've thought about thaat but I'm not in a financial situation to afford that
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can provide you with a list of places that will offer a few counselling sessions for free. I think you need to be able to talk this out with a professional.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: that would be great
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I think that you need to accept that your parents' opinion should not colour your whole life
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: yeah I should start doing that and not let others affect me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you very muchh for talking with me
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Once your self esteem picks up a little I think that you will find that it's very much easier to ignore other people's input.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You are very welcome! I wish you well in the months to come.
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: My son has moved back from NYC and does not like my boyfriend.

dialog.text: Hello
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: How may I help you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: hi
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am stressed with my 25 year old moved back from NYC. . My boyfriend and I have a home and my son does not like him.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am sorry to hear that i can understand how you must be feeling
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Why does your son not like your boyfriend?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He is going back to school and I am supporting him in that. The problem is that my boyfriend thinks my son should speak to me more respectfully. He gets upset when my son is swears and shows anger to me.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you talked to your boyfriend about how you are feeling?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He knows that I am torn. I am not going to put my son out of the house. I am also not one to get loud and angry. My son verbally is aggressive.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can understand why your boyfriend be getting upset if your son is disrespectful to you and is aggressive but you know that is your son and you going to be there for him no matter what
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, and I have gotten my son to go to a therapist weekly to try to express his anger about the pandemic and the changes it has brought in his lifestyle. He cannot take his frustrustations out on us.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: How long has this been going on?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Is the therapist working for him?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He came back last March for what we thought at the time would be a month or two.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you had a conversation with your son about the way he is acting?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: He is difficult to get through to. He seems to have traded midwestern charm for NYC bullying.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Maybe he should start seeing a therapist every day maybe that will help
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am not sure that he can afford that, but I have seen small changes in his behavior since he started seeing her. I want him to stop seeing my boyfriend as the enemy.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: maybe your boyfriend and your son needs to sit down and have a talk
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That may work with a therapist. I have tried to mediate and both were terribly bull headed and argumentative.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: or you know your boyfriend can plan out a day or something and your son and your boyfriend can go out and do something fun
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am a quiet person and I want a happy household.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: They should have a talk because communication is key and that will solve a lot
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you. You are right. I just want to get rid of the tension in the house.
dialog.speaker: usr

I think you should try getting out of the house and enjoying fresh air and physical activity.  It won't cure your depression but it may help your headspace and your point of view.

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: But if you're reliving a traumatic moment, it may be beneficial to seek out a licensed therapist who can help you process and move past the moment.

situation: I got fired from my job during the pandemic, I don't know if I'll be able to find another job.

dialog.text: Hello, How can I help you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'm scared about my future
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Can you tell me more about why you are scared for the future?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I got fired because of Covid, and I don't know how I'll be able to find a job and have an income.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It seems that Covid has had a negative effect on your employment and financial insecurity is weighing heavily on you.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes that is correct, and with the job market, how am I supposed to find a secured job.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I can understand that feeling of insecurity, and how helpless you feel. I myself have been in the position of loss of income and financial insecurity in the past, and while it was hard while I was in the valley, I was able to walk out of it with some valuable lessons.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is true, I just have to work hard for myself. I am learning valuable lessons like the idea that companies don't care about their workers, etc. Working more on myself sounds like the better option.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It sounds like you are already identifying areas of self improvement. A person with confidence in themselves and the ability to reflect and grow are promising attributes potential employers look for.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for all that you've done today, I couldn't get through it without you dude.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Thank you for your time today, hearing my concerns about the future!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are so welcome. I know that you will succeed in your employment search as you have the skills and humility that potential employers are looking for.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I'll continue to keep on the lookout for new job opportunities, as well as improving myself for the long term. I appreciate it!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: As you continue your job search, can you think of ways that you could trim your cost of living for the short term? Returning to the basics for a time could help save you money while you take the next steps with your career. Things like planning meals ahead of time, using items you already have instead of buying new, letting go of subscriptions you don't use daily or don't deem necessary.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I could definitely reduce my spending like going out less for fast food, cutting my Netflix and Hulu subscriptions, and prepare my own meals for the next week weeks, as I try to find a new job. This would definitely help with my concerns about income and financial security.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Our lifestyle seems to be all about convenience and instant gratification, I myself being guilty of wanting those as well. But I think when we strip our needs down to the basics for a while we allow ourselves to find what is really necessary, as well as what is truly important to us.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Very true, people definitely need to find their fitting for when things go wrong. Failure or bad events give us time to think about the important things in life, as well as our true needs.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: And it is important to remember that everyone goes through cycles of feast or famine, and that when you are walking through a famine you yourself are not a failure. As long as you know you are doing your best to succeed under the circumstances you have been handed, you will never truly be a failure to yourself or to others.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you, this has really helped me overcome my anxiety and fears of the events from the past year!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am so glad you have been able to look within yourself to see that you have all the resources you need to handle this period of life. You have a optimistic attitude and a can do spirit, and those will take you far!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thank you for your time, I'll have to be leaving now, this will help me for sure!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Enjoy the rest of your day!
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I have had a lady who has been a friend for one year now. We have been in good terms until recently when she no longer has time for me and she does not explain the reason for the same. I have scheduled several meetings but she turns down my request every time. I dont know what to do at such a time when i need her support the most.

dialog.text: How are you doing today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Am not very fine though tring to cope with the situation at hand
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What situation specifically are you speaking of, if you would like to tell me?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am currently facing some sadness. I have had a fiancee whom we have been in good terms for the past one year. She has suddenly changed and no longer has ime for me. I have prompted her on several occasions but she does not respond to my calls and texts.I have requested her so that we meet and talk but she is not willing either. I am confused what to do at this time i need her support the most
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: So what I hear you saying is that you are engaged and your fiance will not speak to you.  However, you are  unsure as to why she is behaving this way?  Is that correct?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yea i really dont know the reason behind the breakup coz all along we  have been in good terms and can hardly remember us having a disagreement
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Unfortunately sometimes people do just grow apart.  There may not be any concrete reason behind it.  It appears that, for whatever reason, she does not want to talk.  I can understand how this would be upsetting and that it would be hard to obtain closure and move on.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sure. I really dont know what to do in this case
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Have you tried emailing her?  Perhaps she would be willing to explain in a more neutral environment?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Well, i haven`t tried an email. I have only called her severally, sent her message via whatsapp and facebook.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: It might be an option.  Maybe just lay out how you feel in it, and just ask her for an explanation perhaps.  It might be good to let her know that "I understand it's over, but could you help me understand why so that I can close this chapter" - perhaps she would respond to something like that.  If she doesn't, then you are going to have to make some hard decisions and try to process this.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: It's a very hard position to be in, but life is too beautiful to be miserable, and I know you would rather be happy.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Sure i also want to be happy but we have shared so much in common and were in process of starting something good to help generate income. She had the idea and i had the capital. I feel this will really be a wasted opprtunity
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Is there anything else i can do to salvage the situation?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You are going to have to lay it all on the line with her, but be prepared for her to not respond in the way that you want.  Sometimes we do the best we can, and it still doesn't change the situation.  Just know that her decision does not mean you are unworthy, it just means that she is not worthy of you - but someone else is and then it would be time to go and find them.

dialog.text: Wow. This is interesting. Thanks for this reminder. I gonna consider this idea and move on then. Thanks for this support

dialog.text: You are more than welcome.  I know it's hard, but sometimes the rain has to come before the rainbow!

dialog.text: Ok thank you. I will apply your advice and see how it will turn out. Thank you once more

dialog.text: I wish you the best of luck!

situation: SInce my divorce, I am constantly worried about being able to pay my bills and general sad most of the time.  The Covid issue is making it worst.

dialog.text: hello
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Hello, how can i help you today?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Just feeling sad
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Tell me more. What has you feeling sad?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Not being able to leave the house with Covid.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: plus my hours were cut at work.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I completely understand. I am also going through the same. I have not left my house in weeks. While I am able to work from home, my hours were also cut.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: What would help you feel better about the situation? What are you doing to pass the time?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes it sucks.  I live alone now so there really hard sometimes.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I tend to watch tv and lot and watch YouTube videos.  Nothing productive.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I also live alone. So I can understand how you are feeling. You are not alone in this situation. Although you may feel that way. Have you tried connecting with friends via text, video call, etc? Sometimes that helps, even if it's not the same as face to face.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Yes, I have one close friend that I talk to every now and then.  Its not like it use to be.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Don't feel like you need to do a lot to be productive. Even getting up to watch tv is still getting up to do something. That's still a win.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We used to be able to go out and have a few beers together.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That's good. Keep that connection. It's not going to be the same due to the circumstances. But at least you are seeking to keep that connection, and that is a good thing.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I hope that this vaccine thing is reason and we can get back to the norm.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: What I found helped somewhat was joining a few social groups online. find something you like and find a group related to that. For example, I love horror movies, so I joined a horror movie group on Facebook. While it's not face to face, it is a good opportunity to just connect with others about a common interest.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Good idea..
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I am hoping they get the vaccine going as well. But I am hoping they get it right, and not just rush to get something out there that may or may not work.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I like to do home repairs.  Maybe I can find a group for that.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Im sure you can! Maybe write a blog about the repairs you can do to your home, since you are there anyway.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Do you use any other social media for connecting with new people.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I use Facebook, Instagram, and sometimes TikTok
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You should do mini videos on easy things to DIY on TikTok.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: True.  I have to change out a few old style electrical plugs.  Maybe I can do something on that?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: right! That is a great idea!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I saw a few TikTok videos but never post a video.  Is it hard to post on there?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: not really. what i do is record the video beforehand, and then upload it.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Oh.  Okay.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: But you can also record it straight to the app.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: You can also do the same on SnapChat
dialog.speaker: sys

situation: I broke up with my girlfriend and sad about it

dialog.text: Hello, how is your life at the moment? Do you want to talk about anything?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am doing ok. I just broke up with my girlfriend and sad about it
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: so I hear you are not feeling at all your best at the moment?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That is correct.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you feel as though you have no-one to talk to about this situation? I am happy to listen.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I am so sad and just wonder why did it happen!!!
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you have no idea? Do you think you might have done something wrong or perhaps she was being unfaithful to you?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: We had simple disagreement and both of us were keep fighting.. now I can not get over it.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Do you consider that there might be any hope for the  two of you at all?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I don't know. What should I do?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Well, I think you should give her some space but people do sometimes get back together after they've separated
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I see your point.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: You really do need to give her some space though - don't crowd her
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Should I call her directly? What should I say?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: I would give her a little time. Maybe two or three days? She might need some time to clear her head
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's a good idea. What should I say? Should I apologize?
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: Perhaps you could send flowers and a note asking her if she'd like to talk?
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: That's a good idea. I will try that. Thank you.
dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: She might be feeling receptive to that but if she's not you might have to accept that it's over.
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks.
dialog.speaker: usr

situation: I have been dating this guy for 3 years and I'm tired of where our relationship is at the moment . I had expected him to propose long before now and since he hasn't I have chosen to call it quits as I'm no longer getting young and so afraid of wasting time with him.

dialog.speaker: usr

dialog.text: That is tough, but sometimes people just portray things differently, for instance I am also very laid back and nonchalant about most things which can lead to miscommunications.

dialog.text: You need to know where he is so you can make a good decision for yourself!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: I know it is difficult, but I know you can get through it!

dialog.text: Good, I am happy for you!

dialog.text: Thank you very much, you've been a great help

dialog.text: I am glad I was able to help!
dialog.speaker: sys

dialog.text: Thanks, it was nice chatting with you.

dialog.text: You're welcome! If you need any more help just chat back with us again.
